column1: Manischewitz Blackberry Kosher, Red Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: The Manischewitz winery is located in Canandaigua, New York, and is best known for its budget concord wine. Aged in steel tanks at cold temperatures to maintain fruit aromas. This blackberry wine has the aromas and flavors of blackberry jam with just the right amount of sweetness. The crisp acidity balances the sweetness and up front fruit aromas. The natural fruitiness, allows this wine to be served chilled. Pairs well with roasted meats with fruit sauces, or paired with berry based desserts.

column1: Manischewitz Concord Kosher, Red Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: The Manischewitz winery is located in Canandaigua, New York, and is best known for its budget concord wine. It is aged in steel tanks at cold temperatures to maintain fruit aromas. A sweet wine with a pleasant mouth feel and a smooth aftertaste. A smooth fruity wine with plenty of grape flavor and a subtle aroma of confectionery flavors. The crisp acidity balances the sweetness and up front fruit aromas. The natural fruitiness allows this wine to be served chilled. Goes wonderfully with barbecued meats, and fruity desserts.

column1: Meiomi Chardonnay, White Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: To create the unrivaled taste of Meiomi, we grow our grapes in three sought after regions along the California coast —Monterey, Sonoma, and Santa Barbara counties. Fruit from all three exceptional maritime regions is blended to create a richly layered, well-balanced, and expressive wine. Meiomi Chardonnay has smooth pineapple and lemon peel aromas with honey and almonds. This white wine has full flavors, succulent acidity, and a mineral-driven finish. It pairs well with roasted chicken, fresh crab, soft cheeses, or creamy pasta. Best enjoyed chilled.

column1: Mark West Chardonnay, White Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: Mark West Wines accepts nothing less than the best, which is why we source the fruit for our the wines is sourced from the finest vineyards throughout California. After harvest, the grapes were gently crushed and underwent two to three weeks of cool fermentation—that's what makes it fresh! The wine was aged in French oak. This chardonnay has citrus and pear aromas followed by lush peach, melon, green apple, and mineral flavors with a toasty oak finish. This white wine pairs best with grilled cheese with tomato soup, a cobb salad, grilled salmon, or really go for it with apple pie à la mode.

column1: Rex Goliath Chardonnay, White Wine, 1.5 L Bottle
column2: At the turn of the 20th century, Rex Goliath, the “World’s Largest Rooster”, was the treasured attraction of a Texas circus. We honor Rex with our premium varietal wines. Mark Ferguson joined the team as a winemaker in 2011 and has added his expertise to every bottle ever since. He brings enthusiasm and comprehensive experience and works to continue the legacy of bold flavors and big personality for which the wines have become known. This wine is a true sun-kissed chardonnay with bold aromas of apple and pear, combined with the classic spices of Grandma's apple pie. We’ve added a splash of aromatic white varietals to provide layers of delicate floral notes coupled with bright citrus character. It's the ultimate food wine.

column1: Robert Mondavi Private Selection Meritage, Red Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: Robert Mondavi Private Selection was founded in 1994 by Robert Mondavi to capture the delicious flavors from California's best coastal vineyards. He inherently recognized the Central Coast's potential to produce phenomenal grapes - and, ultimately, wines of the utmost quality - at a more accessible price. They exude the fresh fruit character and bright acidity that can only come from a wine by the influence of the Pacific Ocean. This meritage has flavors dark plum, blackberry, black cherry, black currant, and black pepper. Aromas open with hints of mulling spice and dark chocolate. This red wine pairs well with grilled steak and stew.

column1: Robert Mondavi Winery Napa Valley Fume Blanc, White Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: The unique geography and climate of the California coast are what allows Robert Mondavi Wines to grow a variety of grapes that give the wines their distinctive character and intense fruit flavor. The grapes soak up sun in the afternoon and are cooled by evening fog. They mature slowly, developing intense, pure fruit flavors unique to California coastal vineyards. Deliciously complex orange marmalade, honey, and marzipan flavors mix together with caramelized red apples, nuts, brown sugar, nougat, buttery crust, and a lively orange zest for an elaborate taste.

column1: Ravenswood Vintners Blend Cabernet Sauvignon, Red Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: Ravenswood strives to put what is picked from the fields right into the bottle. Capturing the spirit of the California appellation and the popular Vintners Blend bottlings sourced from vineyards throughout California. From Dry Creek north of Healdsburg, to the edge of the bay of the Carneros Valley, founder Joel Peterson has forged strong bonds with a cadre of grape growers who share Ravenswood's commitment and stubborn independence. Black currant and cassis on the nose, with spicy cherry on the palate with subtle tobacco notes, black cherry, and fresh herbs. Varietal: 100% cabernet sauvignon.

column1: Tom Gore Vineyards Chardonnay, White Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: For Tom Gore, farming isn’t a profession; it’s a way of life. His family helped develop the vineyards of Northern California appellation into a world-class winemaking region. Tom grows his grapes using meticulous farming techniques, and works closely with winemakers. Together, they taste the wines at various stages throughout their development and collaborate on the blending process. Fermented in 60% barrel and 40% stainless steel, our chardonnay is pale gold in color with intense aromas of Fiji apple with lightly tropical notes of citrus and juicy, ripe pear complemented by toasted oak and spice. The fruit follows through in the flavor with bright acidity balanced by a creamy texture and a long, full finish. Varietal: 98% chardonnay, 2% sauvignon blanc.

column1: Tom Gore Vineyards Cabernet Sauvignon, Red Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: For Tom Gore, farming isn’t a profession; it’s a way of life. His family helped develop the vineyards of Northern California appellation into a world-class winemaking region. Tom grows his grapes using meticulous farming techniques, and works closely with winemakers. Together, they taste the wines at various stages throughout their development and collaborate on the blending process. Aged 10 months in French oak barrels, our cabernet sauvignon is dark ruby red in color with aromas of blackberry and black currant with toasted notes of oak, brown spice, and mocha. This fruit-forward wine is full of dark fruit flavors and complemented by a rich mouthfeel and soft round tannins. Varietal: 79% cabernet sauvignon, 11% malbec, 5% merlot, 5% other reds.

column1: Toasted Head Cabernet Sauvignon, Red Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: Handcrafting wines since 1995, Toasted Head's estate vineyards in Yolo's Dunnigan Hills. A designated American Viticultural Area on the eastern side of California's North Coast appellation perched on rolling hillsides with well-drained gravelly loam soils. Named for the age-old practice of toasting barrel heads with fire, which is what helps to create the distinct toasted flavors in all our wines. This cabernet sauvignon opens with ripe plum and dark berry fruits on the nose accompanied by graham cracker toastiness from oak aging. Our medium-bodied cabernet showcases flavors of blackberry, cassis with hints of cloves and vanilla, finishing with soft, supple tannins. Varietal: 100% cabernet sauvignon.

column1: Vendange Chardonnay, White Wine, 1.5 L Bottle
column2: Established as one of America’s best-selling wines, Vendange offers a selection of well-balanced, approachable and high-quality varietal wines that are always fresh and ready to enjoy. Easily recognized by its elegant and distinctive triangle-shaped label, Vendange is the ideal wine for entertaining or enjoying with a meal at home. With its fruit-forward varietal characteristics, Vendange wines are perfect for everyday consumption. This chardonnay has an inviting aroma of freesia, along with green apple and added layers from oak. It is a full-flavored, balanced, delicious white wine with some apple and pear notes and a hint of toasted oak. Pairs well with barbecued shrimp, chicken focaccia sandwich, or grilled glazed salmon.

column1: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi Chardonnay, White Wine, 4 pk 187 mL Plastic Bottles
column2: As the central valley heats up, cool maritime breezes are drawn across Woodbridge's Lodi region winery creating a Mediterranean-like climate of warm days and cool nights ideal for growing premium grapes. By using state-of-the-art technology for winemaking, employing unique growing techniques, and cultivating relationships with the local growers, Woodbridge is able to help ensure high quality grapes that would produce excellent wines. Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi Chardonnay displays aromas of tropical fruit with a hint of cinnamon and maple, leading to a rich, toasty finish. This vibrant, medium-bodied white wine pairs well with appetizers, including grilled summer vegetables and fresh fruits. Fine wines for everyday enjoyment, since 1979.

column1: Wild Horse Cabernet Sauvignon, Red Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: Situated at a midpoint in the Central Coast, the Templeton vineyard and winery location is ideal for sourcing fruit from vineyards north and south of the winery, along with its low-vigor soils, proven ground water table, and rural atmosphere. The varieties of soil composition and micro-climates that can be found within the expansive Central Coast appellation present the opportunity to cultivate the same varietal in a wide range of growing conditions. This Wild Horse cabernet sauvignon has aromas of dark fruit, blackberry, and cassis with light notes of blue fruit, vanilla, cola spice, and subtle tobacco notes. Flavors of sweet oak, vibrant red and dark fruit, light herbs, and bramble spice. Pairs well with grilled steak, blue cheeseburger with sautéed mushroom and a side of truffle fries. Varietal: 88% cabernet sauvignon, 10% petit verdot, 2% malbec.

column1: Wild Horse Merlot, Red Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: Situated at a midpoint in the Central Coast, the Templeton vineyard and winery location is ideal for sourcing fruit from vineyards north and south of the winery, along with its low-vigor soils, proven ground water table, and rural atmosphere. The varieties of soil composition and micro-climates that can be found within the expansive Central Coast appellation present the opportunity to cultivate the same varietal in a wide range of growing conditions. This Wild Horse merlot has rich aromas of plum and raspberry with notes of blue fruit, clove, and cooking spice. Brings red and black fruit flavors to a full approachable tannins, balanced acidity, and a long finish. Pairs well with roasted fennel and pork tenderloin and grilled portabella mushrooms. Varietal: 90% merlot, 6% tempranillo, 4% petite verdot.

column1: Franciscan Cabernet Sauvignon, Red Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: Founded in 1973, Franciscan has a long tradition of crafting wine with a highly meticulous approach. Franciscan's home estate is located in Oakville, right in the heart of the Napa Valley appellation. This 240-acre parcel of land features loamy, gravelly, well-draining soil which adds structure to the wines. At Franciscan Estate, the wine lots are kept separate from the vineyard until just before bottling. After picking by hand, every load of grapes is assigned its own tank. This cabernet sauvignon has aromas of lush berry fruit, hazelnut, and vanilla. This wine has notes of fruit, vanilla, clove, and tobacco, leading to a seamless, soft, and gentle finish. Varietal: 87% cabernet sauvignon, 9% merlot, 2% malbac, 2% petit verdot.

column1: Hogue Chardonnay, White Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: The majority of Washington’s wine grapes are planted east of the Cascade Range in the Columbia Valley appellation, which encompasses the Yakima Valley and Walla Walla appellations. The Columbia Valley covers 18,000 square miles and provides a huge range of geographical and climatic conditions for grape growing. Hogue Cellars wine is made with grapes that have intense fruit flavors and high natural acidity, which is why it is one of the most recognized names in Washington wines. This chardonnay reveals juicy apple and pear on the nose, with lemon meringue pie, creamy vanilla oak, and toast. A well-balanced palate follows with flavors of fresh apple pie, lemon curd, and cream. Pairs well with salmon-stuffed crab cakes, grilled lemon chicken, and fettuccini alfredo.

column1: Ruffino Chianti DOCG, Red Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: Pair Ruffino Chianti DOCG with a variety of traditional Italian dishes such as ravioli, margherita pizza, and beef carpaccio. It will be simply perfect. This red wine's brightness and acidity also make it a great companion for international favorites such as the classic hamburger. Grapes from the best-known regions of Chianti are used to make our Chianti DOCG. Fermentation is aided by racking and punch-downs in temperature-controlled stainless steel and concrete vats. Our Chianti DOCG is then aged for four months in stainless steel and concrete vats. Chianti DOCG occupies a special place in the heart - and history - of Ruffino. When Ilario and Leopoldo Ruffino founded the winery in 1877, the first wine they produced was a Chianti. And it was the reputation of this wine that launched Ruffino's early success. In fact, before World War I Ruffino was the only Chianti exported from Italy to the United States, making it an ambassador to wine lovers around the world. In keeping with tradition, Chianti DOCG features a distinct Florentine bottle reminiscent of the fiasco, the straw-dressed flask in which Chianti was originally bottled. Today, Ruffino Chianti DOCG serves as a benchmark for quality and consistency. For many wine lovers worldwide, Ruffino Chianti is Chianti.

Starting with the best quality fruit, Ruffino wines reveal themselves without coaxing or manipulation. This is the essence of Ruffino's traditional approach to making wine. column1: Kim Crawford Pinot Gris, White Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: Kim Crawford's philosophy on making good wine is simple: focus on flavor. With grapes grown between the latitudes of 34 and 47 degrees, Kim Crawford's growing regions cover a distance of 1,000 miles from the northern tip of New Zealand to the southern coast. Within these regions the climates vary and allow winemakers to select from an assortment of grapes producing the diverse and flavorful wines Kim Crawford is known for. Kim Crawford Pinot Gris opens with aromas of ripe pear and quince with honey, floral notes, and a touch of citrus. On the palate, this white wine is clean and fresh with Braeburn apple and florals adding complexity. It is an ideal wine by itself or paired with antipasto, fresh seafood, Southeast Asian cuisine.

column1: Robert Mondavi Winery Reserve Napa Valley Cabernet Sauvignon, Red Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: The unique geography and climate of the California coast are what allows Robert Mondavi Wines to grow a variety of grapes that give the wines their distinctive character and intense fruit flavor. The grapes soak up sun in the afternoon and are cooled by evening fog. They mature slowly, developing intense, pure fruit flavors unique to California Coastal vineyards. This Robert Mondavi Winery Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon is grown in Napa Valley, California and is a 2015 vintage. This cabernet is full-bodied, rich and concentrated in the mouth, the ripe opulent black fruit is well supported by velvety tannins and plenty of freshness, finishing long and spicy. This wine is composed of 92% cabernet sauvignon, 4% merlot, 2% petit verdot, and 2% cabernet franc.

column1: Black Box Malbec, Red Wine, 3 L Box
column2: Made from grapes harvested in world-class appellations, Black Box Wines have won over 70 Gold Medals at wine competitions throughout the US and have been awarded over 34 Wine Enthusiast Best Buys. Through a meticulous winemaking process, each of our wines is crafted to be food-friendly, fruit-forward and easy-to-drink. One 3-liter box contains the same amount of wine as four 750ml bottles, is 40% less expensive than comparable bottled wines, and stays fresh for six weeks after opening. Our Malbec explodes with rich blackberry aromas, juicy plum flavors and hints of leather and chocolate. This red wine has a balanced acidity that leads to a velvety finish and pairs perfectly with meats or grilled vegetables.

column2: Our limited release Robert Mondavi Private Selection Rum Barrel Aged Merlot blends the craftmanship of California winemaking with exotic tradition of Dark Rum barrel aging. Our coastal California vineyards deliver jammy flavors of plum and blueberry to the wine. This merlot has flavors of dark plum and berry with complex nuances of toasted coconut, molasses, and brown spices from the aged Rum barrels. There are sweet aromas of molasses, vanilla, mocha, cocoa powder, and  spiced rum cake. This red wine pairs well with Caribbean rum cake, pasta bolognese, Korean short ribs, Jamaican jerk chicken, spicy coconut curry, dark chocolate, brie with fig jam and a white sandy beach at sunset.

column1: Kim Crawford Signature Reserve Marlborough Sauvignon Blanc, White Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: Kim Crawford's philosophy on making good wine is simple: focus on flavor. With grapes grown between the latitudes of 34 and 47 degrees, Kim Crawford's growing regions cover a distance of 1,000 miles from the northern tip of New Zealand to the southern coast. Within these regions the climates vary and allow winemakers to select from an assortment of grapes producing diverse and flavorful wines Kim Crawford is known for. Signature Reserve Sauvignon Blanc is sourced from select small lots along Marlborough's coastal plains and valleys which allows grapes in each sub-region to develop characters unique to their terroir. This white wine reveals intense, lifted aromatics of tropical fruit like passionfruit and zesty grapefruit that lead into a range of complex flavors, including distinct mineral notes accenting its rich, hefty palate, that last through a clean, crisp finish. Pairs well with herb-crusted rack of lamb, seafood risotto with mussels, shrimp, and scallops, or a light spinach and goat cheese salad.

column1: Kim Crawford Fizz Methode Traditionnelle, White Sparkling Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: Kim Crawford's philosophy on making good wine is simple: focus on flavor. The exceptional grapes were selected from small batches and crafted into our Small Parcels range. With grapes grown between the latitudes of 34 degrees and 47 degrees, Kim Crawford's growing regions cover a distance of 1,000 miles from the northern tip of New Zealand to the southern coast. Within these regions the climates vary and allow winemakers to select from an assortment of grapes producing the diverse and flavorful wines Kim Crawford is known for. This Kim Crawford Fizz Methode Traditionnelle is a harmonious blend of the finest pinot noir and chardonnay grapes and exhibits delicate citrus fruit layered with toasty brioche characters. The palate on this sparkling wine has a soft, creamy texture and refreshing natural acidity with a finish that is crisp and dry.

column1: Black Box Pinot Grigio, White Wine, 3 L Box
column2: Made from grapes harvested in world-class appellations, Black Box Wines have won over 70 Gold Medals at wine competitions throughout the US and have been awarded over 34 Wine Enthusiast Best Buys. Through a meticulous winemaking process, each of our wines is crafted to be food-friendly, fruit-forward and easy-to-drink. One 3-liter box contains the same amount of wine as four 750ml bottles, is 40% less expensive than comparable bottled wines, and stays fresh for six weeks after opening. Our award-winning Pinot Grigio expresses gentle aromas of pear and honeydew as juicy flavors of citrus and apples lead to a bright finish. This delicious white wine pairs well with chicken, seafood, grilled vegetables or salads.

column2: As the central valley heats up, cool maritime breezes are drawn across Woodbridge's Lodi region winery creating a Mediterranean-like climate of warm days and cool nights ideal for growing premium grapes. By using state-of-the-art technology for winemaking, employing unique growing techniques, and cultivating relationships with the local growers, Woodbridge is able to help ensure high quality grapes that would produce excellent wines. Merlot’s lush, plummy aromas, silky dried cherries, and raspberry flavors complement the cabernet’s structure, along with blackberry, and cherry jam flavors, with hints of vanilla oak in this cabernet merlot. This Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi Cabernet Sauvignon Merlot pairs well with a number of dishes, particularly hearty grilled or roasted beef, pork, chicken, or game. Fine wines for everyday enjoyment, since 1979.

column1: Vendange Chardonnay, White Wine, 2 pk 1.5 L Bottles
column2: Established as one of America’s best-selling wines, Vendange offers a selection of well-balanced and high-quality varietal wines at reasonable prices. Easily recognized by its elegant and distinctive triangle-shaped label, Vendange is the ideal wine for entertaining or enjoying with a meal at home. With its fruit-forward varietal characteristics, Vendange wine is perfect for everyday consumption. This chardonnay has an inviting aroma of freesia, along with green apple and added layers from oak. It is a full-flavored, balanced, delicious wine with some apple and pear notes and a hint of toasted oak.

column1: Robert Mondavi Private Selection Merlot, Red Wine, 1.5 L Bottle
column2: Robert Mondavi Private Selection was founded in 1994 by Robert Mondavi to capture the delicious flavors from California's best coastal vineyards. He inherently recognized the Central Coast's potential to produce phenomenal grapes - and, ultimately, wines of the utmost quality - at a more accessible price. They exude the fresh fruit character and bright acidity that can only come from a wine by the influence of the Pacific Ocean. This merlot has flavors of rich cherry, ripe plum, milk chocolate and roasted coffee. It has aromas of ripe red cherry, Asian plum and cranberry with hints of black olive, tea leaf, baking spice and sweet oak. This red wine pairs well with rotisserie chicken, meat ravioli, wild salmon, and herbed cheese.

column1: J. Roget Spumante, White Sparkling Wine, 1.5 L Bottle
column2: J Roget Spumante American sparkling wine is a beautiful straw color. 100% stainless steel tanks are used for the base wine and then secondary fermentation takes place in the Charmat tanks. This process preserves the fruit character, making a fresher, more flavorful wine. This American sparkling wine is medium-dry with crisp fruit flavors. The aromas of apple and pear are balanced with a bouquet of toasty yeast notes and floral nuances. This sparkling wine is sweet with outstanding fruit flavor and a long smooth finish. Blends beautifully into full-flavored cocktails. Alcohol 9.5%.

Cook's Grande Reserve has a complex profile due, in part, to a special dosage of brandy that emphasizes vanilla and toasty yeast. column1: J. Roget Spumante, White Sparkling Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: J Roget Spumante American sparkling wine is a beautiful straw color. 100% stainless steel tanks are used for the base wine and then secondary fermentation takes place in the Charmat tanks. This process preserves the fruit character, making a fresher, more flavorful wine. This American sparkling wine is medium-dry with crisp fruit flavors. The aromas of apple and pear are balanced with a bouquet of toasty yeast notes and floral nuances. This sparkling wine is sweet with outstanding fruit flavor and a long smooth finish. column1: Paul Masson Burgundy, Red Wine, 3 L Bottle
column2: In 1901, Paul Masson founded the Mountain Winery and became a pioneer in the California wine industry. Tables Wines are fruit-forward, versatile blends that are easy to drink. This wine is an exceptional wine, fermented in contact with grape skins to extract color and flavor and was aged in stainless steel tanks to maintain varietal fruit character. Featuring blackberry, black currant, and herbal aromas and flavors delivered in a dry wine, this burgundy is great by itself or with red meat, lamb, and tomato-based pasta dishes. It’s available in the only carafe package in the industry. The appealing design is reusable and the flared neck makes handling and pouring easy.

column1: J. Roget American Champagne Brut, White Sparkling Wine, 187 mL Bottle
column2: J. Roget offers great-tasting champagnes that also blend beautifully into full-flavored cocktails. This American sparkling wine is medium-dry with crisp fruit flavors. 100% stainless steel tanks are used for the base wine and then secondary fermentation takes place in the Charmat tanks. This process preserves the fruit character, making a fresher, more flavorful wine. The aromas are balanced with a bouquet of toasty yeast notes and floral nuances.

column1: Black Box Chardonnay, White Wine, 3 L Box
column2: Made from grapes harvested in world-class appellations, Black Box Wines have won over 70 Gold Medals at wine competitions throughout the US and have been awarded over 34 Wine Enthusiast Best Buys. Through a meticulous winemaking process, each of our wines is crafted to be food-friendly, fruit-forward and easy-to-drink. One 3-liter box contains the same amount of wine as four 750ml bottles, is 40% less expensive than comparable bottled wines, and stays fresh for six weeks after opening. Our award-winning Chardonnay boasts a rich palate of mango, pineapple and a hint of oak. This white wine has excellent depth and structure that leads to a complex finish and perfectly complements grilled chicken or fish.

column1: Hogue Cabernet Sauvignon, Red Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: The majority of Washington’s wine grapes are planted east of the Cascade Range in the Columbia Valley appellation, which encompasses the Yakima Valley and Walla Walla appellations. The Columbia Valley covers 18,000 square miles and provides a huge range of geographical and climatic conditions for grape growing. Hogue Cellars wine is made with grapes that have intense fruit flavors and high natural acidity, which is why it is one of the most recognized names in Washington wines. Eastern Washington’s warm days and cool nights provide the perfect conditions for producing Hogue Cellars Cabernet Sauvignon. This cabernet sauvignon offers up a bouquet of black cherry, spicy oak, and tobacco, with sassafras and cassis notes. Pair with pork roast, barbecued baby back ribs, or grilled sausages.

The Columbia Valley covers 18,000 square miles and provides a huge range of geographical and climatic conditions for grape growing.  Hogue Cellars wine is made with grapes that have intense fruit flavors and high natural acidity, which is why it is one of the most recognized names in Washington wines. The Genesis Cabernet Sauvignon's grapes were picked at mid-day and during the late afternoon to encourage fermentation. This cabernet opens with blueberry, cherry, strawberry, molasses, dried tobacco leaf, toast, and cream. The palate is rich and creamy with blackberry, vanilla, maple, cocoa, and spice flavors. Pair with braised short ribs, roast pork, or grilled salmon.

column1: Hogue Genesis Syrah, Red Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: The majority of Washington’s wine grapes are planted east of the Cascade Range in the Columbia Valley appellation, which encompasses the Yakima Valley and Walla Walla appellations. The Columbia Valley covers 18,000 square miles and provides a huge range of geographical and climatic conditions for grape growing. Hogue Cellars wine is made with grapes that have intense fruit flavors and high natural acidity, which is why it is one of the most recognized names in Washington wines. The Genesis Columbia Valley Syrah was inoculated for malolactic fermentation and aged for a year in American and French oak barrels, with 25% new oak. This syrah has white pepper, blackberry, and caramel aromas, with spicy, toasty notes and chocolate-covered dried cherries on the palate. Pair with lamb shanks, grilled sausage, or spinach and mushroom lasagna.

column1: Robert Mondavi Winery Napa Valley Cabernet Sauvignon, Red Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: The unique geography and climate of the California coast are what allows Robert Mondavi Wines to grow a variety of delicious grapes that give the wines their distinctive character and intense fruit flavor. The grapes soak up sun in the afternoon and are cooled by evening fog. They mature slowly, developing intense, pure fruit flavors unique to California coastal vineyards. This cabernet features a deep, dark cassis and black cherry fruit, sage, nutmeg, and vanilla spice. It has a velvety texture with a plush, juicy finish that lingers luxuriously on the palate.

column1: Ruffino Aziano Chianti Classico DOCG, Red Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: Producing the best Tuscan wines means having access to the best vineyards. With this in mind, Ruffino has, over the years, assembled a collection of top estates in Tuscany's most important fine wine appellations. Starting with the best quality fruit, Ruffino wines reveal themselves without coaxing or manipulation. This is the essence of Ruffino's traditional approach to making wine. A vibrant and inviting wine, Aziano is characterized by notes of sweet violet, red berries, and wild cherries with slightly spicy undertones. Fruity and harmonious, this wine reveals velvety tannins and an elegant texture. Pairs well with veal roasted with lemon and sage, grilled chicken, and penne and tomatoes.

column1: Ruffino Chianti DOCG, Red Wine, 1.5 L Bottle
column2: Pair Ruffino Chianti DOCG with a variety of traditional Italian dishes such as ravioli, margherita pizza, and beef carpaccio. It will be simply perfect. This red wine's brightness and acidity also make it a great companion for international favorites such as the classic hamburger. Grapes from the best-known regions of Chianti are used to make our Chianti DOCG. Fermentation is aided by racking and punch-downs in temperature-controlled stainless steel and concrete vats. Our Chianti DOCG is then aged for four months in stainless steel and concrete vats. Chianti DOCG occupies a special place in the heart - and history - of Ruffino. When Ilario and Leopoldo Ruffino founded the winery in 1877, the first wine they produced was a Chianti. And it was the reputation of this wine that launched Ruffino's early success. In fact, before World War I Ruffino was the only Chianti exported from Italy to the United States, making it an ambassador to wine lovers around the world. In keeping with tradition, Chianti DOCG features a distinct Florentine bottle reminiscent of the fiasco, the straw-dressed flask in which Chianti was originally bottled. Today, Ruffino Chianti DOCG serves as a benchmark for quality and consistency. For many wine lovers worldwide, Ruffino Chianti is Chianti.

column1: Taylor New York Desserts Cooking Sherry, Red Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: The combination of quality and affordability makes Taylor Dessert Wines an appealing luxury that can be enjoyed every day. Taylor Desserts Cooking Sherry is amber in color and great for cooking and drinking. Taylor Desserts was founded in 1880 with a seven-acre vineyard overlooking Keuka Lake in the Finger Lakes region of New York state. With a special selection of high-quality, sweet, and smooth dessert wines, Taylor is great for cooking or simply enjoying as an after-dinner treat. A nutty character combined with a slight astringency makes this slightly dry wine an impressive standalone beverage, as well as a great addition to some of your favorite recipes. This wine pairs well with pork medallions and roasted vegetables and makes a great addition to sauces and dips.

column1: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi Cabernet Sauvignon, Red Wine, 2 pk 750 mL Bottles
column2: As the central valley heats up, cool maritime breezes are drawn across Woodbridge's Lodi region winery creating a Mediterranean-like climate of warm days and cool nights ideal for growing premium grapes. By using state-of-the-art technology for winemaking, employing unique growing techniques, and cultivating relationships with the local growers, Woodbridge is able to help ensure high quality grapes that would produce excellent wines. Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi Cabernet Sauvignon opens with aromas of cherries, berries, cedar, brown sugar, and toast. Flavors of berries, toasted marshmallow, chocolate, and graham cracker follow with a toasty caramel finish. This medium-bodied red wine pairs deliciously with grilled meats and tomato-based pasta dishes. Fine wines for everyday enjoyment, since 1979.

column1: Rex Goliath Moscato, White Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: At the turn of the 20th century, Rex Goliath, the “World’s Largest Rooster”, was the treasured attraction of a Texas circus. We honor Rex with our premium varietal wines. Mark Ferguson joined the team as a winemaker in 2011 and has added his expertise to every bottle ever since. He brings enthusiasm and comprehensive experience and works to continue the legacy of bold flavors and big personality for which the wines have become known. Rex Goliath wines have won more than 65 gold medals in the major wine competitions. This moscato is bright, crisp, and decadent. It's well-balanced with just the right acidity, combined with floral aromas that bloom into deliciously sweet flavors of peach and apricot.

column2: As the central valley heats up, cool maritime breezes are drawn across Woodbridge's Lodi region winery creating a Mediterranean-like climate of warm days and cool nights ideal for growing premium grapes. column1: Ruffino Prosecco DOC, White Sparkling Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: Producing the best Tuscan wines means having access to the best vineyards. With this in mind, Ruffino has, over the years, assembled a collection of top estates in Tuscany's most important fine wine appellations. Starting with the best quality fruit, Ruffino wines reveal themselves without coaxing or manipulation. This is the essence of Ruffino's traditional approach to making wine. This prosecco has aromas bursting of apples, pears, and citrus, accompanied by hints of wisteria. Crisp, clean, and delicate with fine bubbles on the palate. Intense flavors of apples and peaches lead to a pleasant finish with lingering fruit and floral notes. Pairs well with pizza, fish, shellfish, or white meat dishes. Best served chilled.

column1: Black Box Riesling, White Wine, 3 L Box
column2: Made from grapes harvested in world-class appellations, Black Box Wines have won over 70 Gold Medals at wine competitions throughout the US and have been awarded over 34 Wine Enthusiast Best Buys. Through a meticulous winemaking process, each of our wines is crafted to be food-friendly, fruit-forward and easy-to-drink. One 3-liter box contains the same amount of wine as four 750ml bottles, is 40% less expensive than comparable bottled wines, and stays fresh for six weeks after opening. Our Riesling features ripe stone fruit and nectarine flavors with hints of honey and citrus. This white wine has a delicately balanced acidity with a bright, refreshing finish, and perfectly complements spicy dishes.

column1: Kim Crawford Sauvignon Blanc, White Wine, 375 mL Bottle
column2: Kim Crawford's philosophy on making good wine is simple: focus on flavor. With grapes grown between the latitudes of 34 and 47 degrees, Kim Crawford's growing regions cover a distance of 1,000 miles from the northern tip of New Zealand to the southern coast. Within these regions the climates vary and allow winemakers to select from an assortment of grapes producing diverse and flavorful wines Kim Crawford is known for. Kim Crawford Sauvignon Blanc reveals aromas of lifted citrus, tropical fruit, and crushed herbs. This is a fresh, juicy white wine with ripe, tropical flavors of passion fruit, melon, and grapefruit. It pairs well with fresh oysters, asparagus, lobster, or summer salads.

column1: Cook's California Champagne Moscato, White Sparkling Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: Cook’s California Champagne is produced at the Mission Bell Winery in Madera, California. Cook’s began in 1859 when Isaac Cook created the first American champagne. Cook's wines have been continuing the tradition of being quality champagnes ever since. Sweet and brightly aromatic, Cook’s moscato offers notes of creamy peach, lychee, and citrus fruit. Exotic floral notes of orange blossom and honeysuckle make this wine distinctly moscato. Cook's California Champagne sparkling wines are perfect for every celebration.

column1: Kim Crawford Spitfire Sauvignon Blanc, White Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: Kim Crawford's philosophy on making good wine is simple: focus on flavor. The exceptional grapes were selected from small batches and crafted into our Small Parcels range. With grapes grown between the latitudes of 34 degrees and 47 degrees, Kim Crawford's growing regions cover a distance of 1,000 miles from the northern tip of New Zealand to the southern coast. Within these regions the climates vary and allow winemakers to select from an assortment of grapes producing the diverse and flavorful wines Kim Crawford is known for. Our Spitfire Sauvignon Blanc takes its name from a famous site in Marlborough that was used as an Air Force base during WWII. This white wine is complex with layers of tropical fruit and ripe citrus flavors. It has crisp acidity and a lingering finish that rounds out this stunning wine.

column1: Robert Mondavi Private Selection Merlot, Red Wine, 375 mL Bottle
column2: Robert Mondavi Private Selection was founded in 1994 by Robert Mondavi to capture the delicious flavors from California's best coastal vineyards. He inherently recognized the Central Coast's potential to produce phenomenal grapes - and, ultimately, wines of the utmost quality - at a more accessible price. They exude the fresh fruit character and bright acidity that can only come from a wine by the influence of the Pacific Ocean. This merlot has flavors of rich cherry, ripe plum, milk chocolate and roasted coffee. It has aromas of ripe red cherry, Asian plum and cranberry with hints of black olive, tea leaf, baking spice and sweet oak. This red wine pairs well with rotisserie chicken, meat ravioli, wild salmon, and herbed cheese.

column2: Our limited release Robert Mondavi Private Selection Rum Barrel Aged Merlot blends the craftmanship of California winemaking with exotic tradition of Dark Rum barrel aging. Our coastal California vineyards deliver jammy flavors of plum and blueberry to the wine. This merlot has flavors of dark plum and berry with complex nuances of toasted coconut, molasses, and brown spices from the aged Rum barrels. There are sweet aromas of molasses, vanilla, mocha, cocoa powder, and spiced rum cake. This red wine pairs well with Caribbean rum cake, pasta bolognese, Korean short ribs, Jamaican jerk chicken, spicy coconut curry, dark chocolate, brie with fig jam and a white sandy beach at sunset.

column1: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi Cabernet Sauvignon, Red Wine, 1.5 L Bottle
column2: As the central valley heats up, cool maritime breezes are drawn across Woodbridge's Lodi region winery creating a Mediterranean-like climate of warm days and cool nights ideal for growing premium grapes. By using state-of-the-art technology for winemaking, employing unique growing techniques, and cultivating relationships with the local growers, Woodbridge is able to help ensure high quality grapes that would produce excellent wines. Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi Cabernet Sauvignon opens with aromas of cherries, berries, cedar, brown sugar, and toast. Flavors of berries, toasted marshmallow, chocolate, and graham cracker follow with a toasty caramel finish. This medium-bodied red wine pairs deliciously with grilled meats and tomato-based pasta dishes. Fine wines for everyday enjoyment, since 1979.

column2: As the central valley heats up, cool maritime breezes are drawn across Woodbridge's Lodi region winery creating a Mediterranean-like climate of warm days and cool nights ideal for growing premium grapes. Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi Cabernet Sauvignon opens with aromas of cherries, berries, cedar, brown sugar, and toast. Flavors of berries, toasted marshmallow, chocolate, and graham cracker follow with a toasty caramel finish. This medium-bodied red wine pairs deliciously with grilled meats and tomato-based pasta dishes. Fine wines for everyday enjoyment, since 1979.

column1: Robert Mondavi Private Selection Pinot Grigio, White Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: Robert Mondavi Private Selection was founded in 1994 by Robert Mondavi to capture the delicious flavors from California's best coastal vineyards. He inherently recognized the Central Coast's potential to produce phenomenal grapes - and, ultimately, wines of the utmost quality - at a more accessible price. They exude the fresh fruit character and bright acidity that can only come from a wine by the influence of the Pacific Ocean. This pinot grigio has fresh flavors of melon, citrus, and minerality. It is a medium-bodied wine that shows crisp acidity and ripe fruit flavors. This white wine pairs well with fish tacos, Chinese chicken salad and seafood pastas.

column2: As the central valley heats up, cool maritime breezes are drawn across Woodbridge's Lodi region winery creating a Mediterranean-like climate of warm days and cool nights ideal for growing premium grapes. column1: Black Box Pinot Grigio, White Wine, 500 mL Go Pack
column2: Made from grapes harvested in world-class appellations, Black Box Wines have won over 70 Gold Medals at wine competitions throughout the US and have been awarded over 34 Wine Enthusiast Best Buys. Through a meticulous winemaking process, each of our wines is crafted to be food-friendly, fruit-forward and easy-to-drink. Our award-winning Pinot Grigio expresses gentle aromas of pear and honeydew as juicy flavors of citrus and apples lead to a bright finish. This compact and recyclable 500-milliliter box contains 3 glasses of wine and is a convenient choice for taking high quality wine on-the-go. Enjoy this delicious white wine with soft cheeses or salads at your next picnic or cookout.

column1: Robert Mondavi Winery Reserve Napa Valley Cabernet Sauvignon, Red Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: The unique geography and climate of the California coast are what allows Robert Mondavi Wines to grow a variety of grapes that give the wines their distinctive character and intense fruit flavor. The grapes soak up sun in the afternoon and are cooled by evening fog. This Robert Mondavi Winery Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon is grown in Napa Valley, California and is a 2009 vintage. Profoundly deep, complex flavors echo its aroma with firm, well-integrated tannins, vibrant acidity, and a long, cocoa-mineral finish. This wine is 88% cabernet sauvignon, 8% cabernet franc, and 4% petite verdot.

column1: Hogue Reserve Merlot, Red Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: The majority of Washington’s wine grapes are planted east of the Cascade Range in the Columbia Valley appellation, which encompasses the Yakima Valley and Walla Walla appellations. The Columbia Valley covers 18,000 square miles and provides a huge range of geographical and climatic conditions for grape growing. Hogue Cellars wine is made with grapes that have intense fruit flavors and high natural acidity, which is why it is one of the most recognized names in Washington wines. The Reserve Columbia Valley Merlot underwent malolactic fermentation in barrel and spent 18 to 22 months aging. This merlot is rich and weighty with great structure, nicely integrated oak, and flavors of black cherry, raspberry, vanilla, and a touch of cinnamon and nutmeg. Pair with grilled steak, lamb stew, or curried lentils and wild rice.

column1: Ruffino Lumina DOC Pinot Grigio, White Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: Producing the best Tuscan wines means having access to the best vineyards. With this in mind, Ruffino has, over the years, assembled a collection of top estates in Tuscany's most important fine wine appellations. Starting with the best quality fruit, Ruffino wines reveal themselves without coaxing or manipulation. This is the essence of Ruffino's traditional approach to making wine. The bouquet is fresh and complex, showing refined notes of sage and mint accompanied by an elegant minerality typical of pinot grigio. This wine is medium-bodied, lively, and elegant. Pairs well with prosciutto and mild cheeses, fresh salads, and pasta with cream sauces.

column1: Mark West Pinot Noir, Red Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: Mark West Wines accepts nothing less than the best, which is why the fruit for the wines is sourced from the finest vineyards throughout California’s appellation. To make the best pinot noir, vintners first gently de-stem and crush the grapes when they come into the winery. Daily punch-downs and pump-overs extract flavor and color. At Mark West, there's nothing more important than sharing a passion for pinot with others. This pinot is the original. It is medium-bodied with black cherry, cola, strawberry, plum, and soft tannins. This red wine pairs well with pastas with light, tomato-based sauces, a juicy cheeseburger, grilled salmon, and roasted pork tenderloin, or on its own.

column1: Mark West Santa Lucia Highlands Pinot Noir, Red Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: Mark West Wines accepts nothing less than the best, which is why the fruit for the wines is sourced from the finest vineyards throughout California Santa Lucia Highlands is the ideal place to grow pinot noir, where fog and cool breezes off the Monterey Bay cool hillside plantings. These vineyards yield a small harvest of well-developed fruit.  To make the best pinot noir, vintners first gently de-stem and crush the grapes when they come into the winery. Daily punch-downs and pump-overs extract flavor and color. This pinot noir is rich, deep, and dark, with black cherry, cranberry, and notes of tea, vanilla, caramel, and a delicate, spicy oak. It pairs well with salmon, sushi, and pork tenderloin. At Mark West, there's nothing more important than sharing a passion for pinot with others.

column1: Rex Goliath Chardonnay, White Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: At the turn of the 20th century, Rex Goliath, the “World’s Largest Rooster”, was the treasured attraction of a Texas circus. We honor Rex with our premium varietal wines. Mark Ferguson joined the team as a winemaker in 2011 and has added his expertise to every bottle ever since. He brings enthusiasm and comprehensive experience and works to continue the legacy of bold flavors and big personality for which the wines have become known. Rex Goliath wines have won more than 65 gold medals in the major wine competitions. This wine is a true sun-kissed chardonnay with bold aromas of apple and pear, combined with the classic spices of Grandma's apple pie. We’ve added a splash of aromatic white varietals to provide layers of delicate floral notes coupled with bright citrus character. It's the ultimate food wine.

column1: Rex Goliath Merlot, Red Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: At the turn of the 20th century, Rex Goliath, the “World’s Largest Rooster”, was the treasured attraction of a Texas circus. We honor Rex with our premium varietal wines. Mark Ferguson joined the team as a winemaker in 2011 and has added his expertise to every bottle ever since. He brings enthusiasm and comprehensive experience and works to continue the legacy of bold flavors and big personality for which the wines have become known. Rex Goliath wines have won more than 65 gold medals in the major wine competitions. Mouth-filling flavors of plums, cherries, and wild red berries dominate from start to finish in this merlot. It is soft, supple, and complex with a decidedly spicy nose of black cherry, cassis, and cedar. A perfect match for game fowl, such as pheasant or duck.

column1: Robert Mondavi Winery Reserve Napa Valley Cabernet Sauvignon, Red Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: The unique geography and climate of the California coast are what allows Robert Mondavi Wines to grow a variety of grapes that give the wines their distinctive character and intense fruit flavor. The grapes soak up sun in the afternoon and are cooled by evening fog. They mature slowly, developing intense, pure fruit flavors unique to California Coastal vineyards. This Robert Mondavi Winery Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon is grown in Napa Valley, California and is a 2011 vintage. This cabernet sauvignon tastes of dried herbs, violet-floral, garrigue (a fresh, minty-sage character) and a sense of minerality, in a silky ribbon of flavor that flows elegantly into a long, lingering finish. This wine is 91% cabernet sauvignon, 5% cabernet franc, and 4% petite verdot.

column1: Ruffino Prosecco DOC, White Sparkling Wine, 375 mL Bottle
column2: Producing the best Tuscan wines means having access to the best vineyards. With this in mind, Ruffino has, over the years, assembled a collection of top estates in Tuscany's most important fine wine appellations. Starting with the best quality fruit, Ruffino wines reveal themselves without coaxing or manipulation. This is the essence of Ruffino's traditional approach to making wine. This prosecco has aromas bursting of apples, pears, and citrus, accompanied by hints of wisteria. Crisp, clean, and delicate with fine bubbles on the palate. Intense flavors of apples and peaches lead to a pleasant finish with lingering fruit and floral notes. Pairs well with pizza, fish, shellfish, or white meat dishes. Best served chilled.

column1: Rex Goliath Pinot Grigio, White Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: At the turn of the 20th century, Rex Goliath, the “World’s Largest Rooster”, was the treasured attraction of a Texas circus. We honor Rex with our premium varietal wines. Mark Ferguson joined the team as a winemaker in 2011 and has added his expertise to every bottle ever since. He brings enthusiasm and comprehensive experience and works to continue the legacy of bold flavors and big personality for which the wines have become known. This American appellation pinot grigio has big citrus aromas with layers of fresh stone fruit and intense floral notes. Bright acidity is balanced with fresh citrus, leading to a crisp refreshing finish. This wine pairs especially well with seafood dishes like fresh fish tacos and steamed mussels with broth.

column1: Hogue Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon, Red Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: The majority of Washington’s wine grapes are planted east of the Cascade Range in the Columbia Valley appellation, which encompasses the Yakima Valley and Walla Walla appellations. The Columbia Valley covers 18,000 square miles and provides a huge range of geographical and climatic conditions for grape growing. Hogue Cellars wine is made with grapes that have intense fruit flavors and high natural acidity, which is why it is one of the most recognized names in Washington wines. This cabernet sauvignon offers enticing scents of black currant, blueberry, lavender, black pepper, cocoa, molasses, and dried tobacco, with touches of cream and toast. On the palate, it’s rich and creamy with flavors of blackberry, cherry, dark chocolate, maple, vanilla, and spice. Pair with pepper steak, prime rib, and dark chocolate.

column1: Black Box Pinot Noir, Red Wine, 3 L Box
column2: Made from grapes harvested in world-class appellations, Black Box Wines have won over 70 Gold Medals at wine competitions throughout the US and have been awarded over 34 Wine Enthusiast Best Buys. Through a meticulous winemaking process, each of our wines is crafted to be food-friendly, fruit-forward and easy-to-drink. One 3-liter box contains the same amount of wine as four 750ml bottles, is 40% less expensive than comparable bottled wines, and stays fresh for six weeks after opening. Our Pinot Noir displays aromas of strawberry and cherry with hints of toasty oak. Berry and cocoa flavors and the delicate, lingering finish of this red wine complements roasted poultry or vegetables.

column1: Mark West Carneros Sonoma Pinot Noir, Red Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: Mark West Wines accepts nothing less than the best, which is why the fruit for the wines is sourced from the finest vineyards throughout California. To make the best pinot noir, vintners first gently de-stem and crush the grapes when they come into the winery. Daily punch-downs and pump-overs extract flavor and color. This wine is a dark ruby-red masterpiece with red cherry and cranberry aromas and raspberry, rhubarb, nutmeg, and toasty caramel flavors. Pair perfectly with beef stroganoff, roasted pork chops, and grilled fish with a light cream sauce. At Mark West, there's nothing more important than sharing a passion for pinot with others.

column1: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi Pinot Grigio, White Wine, 4 pk 187 mL Plastic Bottles
column2: As the central valley heats up, cool maritime breezes are drawn across Woodbridge's Lodi region winery creating a Mediterranean-like climate of warm days and cool nights ideal for growing premium grapes. By using state-of-the-art technology for winemaking, employing unique growing techniques, and cultivating relationships with the local growers, Woodbridge is able to help ensure high quality grapes that would produce excellent wines. With aromas of nectarine and fresh peach, Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi Pinot Grigio is crisp and refreshing and a delightful addition to any warm and sunny afternoon and pairs well with seafood and other light dishes.This white wine is a well-rounded with a refreshing peach-citrus finish that pairs nicely with oysters, roast chicken or Brie. Serve slightly chilled. Fine wines for everyday enjoyment, since 1979.

column2: The unique geography and climate of the California coast are what allows Robert Mondavi Wines to grow a variety of delicious grapes that give the wines their distinctive character and intense fruit flavor. The grapes soak up sun in the afternoon and are cooled by evening fog. They mature slowly, developing intense, pure fruit flavors unique to California coastal vineyards. This cabernet features a deep, dark cassis and black cherry fruit, sage, nutmeg, and vanilla spice. It has a velvety texture with a plush, juicy finish that lingers luxuriously on the palate.

column1: Rex Goliath Sangria, Red Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: At the turn of the 20th century, Rex Goliath, the “World’s Largest Rooster”, was the treasured attraction of a Texas circus. We honor Rex with our premium varietal wines. Mark Ferguson joined the team as a winemaker in 2011 and has added his expertise to every bottle ever since. He brings enthusiasm and comprehensive experience and works to continue the legacy of bold flavors and big personality for which the wines have become known. Rex Goliath wines have won more than 65 gold medals in the major wine competitions. This sangria blends the boldness of Rex reds with the refreshingly sweet fruit flavors of lemon, lime, orange, and cherry. It pairs well with an outdoor summer party or barbecue. Serve chilled or over ice and garnish with fresh fruit.

column1: Kim Crawford Wild Grace Chardonnay, White Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: Kim Crawford's philosophy on making good wine is simple: focus on flavor. The exceptional grapes were selected from small batches and crafted into our Small Parcels range. With grapes grown between the latitudes of 34 degrees and 47 degrees, Kim Crawford's growing regions cover a distance of 1,000 miles from the northern tip of New Zealand to the southern coast. Within these regions the climates vary and allow winemakers to select from an assortment of grapes producing the diverse and flavorful wines Kim Crawford is known for. Mid-straw in appearance, this Kim Crawford Wild Grace Chardonnay displays a compelling nose of white peach, citrus, and nutty complexities. The palate of this white wine is weighty and complex, with vibrant citrus fruit characters and a silky texture through to the long, nutty, toasty finish.

column1: Ruffino Lodola Nuova Vino Nobile Di Montepulciano DOCG, Red Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: Producing the best Tuscan wines means having access to the best vineyards. With this in mind, Ruffino has, over the years, assembled a collection of top estates in Tuscany's most important fine wine appellations. Starting with the best quality fruit, Ruffino wines reveal themselves without coaxing or manipulation. This is the essence of Ruffino's traditional approach to making wine. The bouquet reveals intense notes of ripe plum followed by delicate scents of fresh meadow flowers. Spicy sensations and hints of leather and nutmeg complete the nose, offering depth and elegance. Pairs well with roasted game, braised lamb, and seared duck breast.

column1: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi Riesling, White Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: As the central valley heats up, cool maritime breezes are drawn across Woodbridge's Lodi region winery creating a Mediterranean-like climate of warm days and cool nights ideal for growing premium grapes. By using state-of-the-art technology for winemaking, employing unique growing techniques, and cultivating relationships with the local growers, Woodbridge is able to help ensure high quality grapes that would produce excellent wines. With delicate aromas of jasmine, stone fruit, and crisp citrus, Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi Riesling is an excellent alternative to more traditional whites. The white wine's combination of rich, round textures, lightly-sweet flavor, and refreshing acidity makes it easy to enjoy. With slightly lower alcohol content, this Riesling is the perfect wine to pair with a variety of foods, including lightly sautéed chicken, seared scallops, or a crisp apple tart. Or serve it chilled by itself on a warm afternoon. Fine wines for everyday enjoyment, since 1979.

column1: Clos du Bois Chardonnay, White Wine, 375 mL Bottle
column2: Clos du Bois Winery farms almost 800 acres in the vibrantly diverse wine regions of Sonoma County and Coastal California. Working with a family of trusted growers from some of the best vineyards, each vintage is crafted to achieve balance, intensity, and true varietal character. column1: Robert Mondavi Winery Napa Valley Maestro, Red Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: Robert Mondavi, one of the first true pioneers of Napa Valley, was renowned for innovation. In 1966, he founded Robert Mondavi Winery with the vision to produce world-class wines in the Napa Valley. It's only fitting that Maestro, the wine was created to honor him for the 50th anniversary of our winery. Maestro is led by artistic direction in the vineyards to create a unique blend with no formula and working with what the vintage is giving us and we see this as an opportunity to make a true, vintage-driven blend. A crescendo of dark, juicy plum and cassis fruit, violet, cinnamon, and unsweetened cocoa linger on sumptuous sips full of vibrant flavor and plush tannins. A blend of 73% cabernet sauvignon, 23% cabernet franc, 2% merlot, and 2% petit verdot from our two prized vineyards: To Kalon in Oakville and Wappo Hill in Stags Leap.

column1: Mark West Pinot Noir, Red Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: Mark West Wines accepts nothing less than the best, which is why the fruit for the wines is sourced from the finest vineyards throughout California. Daily punch-downs and pump-overs extract flavor and color.  This concentrated ruby red wine is full bodied, rich, and smooth, with hints of black cherries and plums, mocha, vanilla, and caramel. Black fruit flavors add a sophisticated, elegant palate to this luxurious wine with a plush finish. The core reveals a pleasing mix of black cherry, cola, and strawberry. Pairs well with grilled lamb chops, gourmet flatbread pizza, and pulled pork sandwiches are all solid choices. At Mark West, there's nothing more important than sharing a passion for pinot with others.

column1: Robert Mondavi Winery Reserve Napa Valley Cabernet Sauvignon, Red Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: The unique geography and climate of the California coast are what allows Robert Mondavi Wines to grow a variety of grapes that give the wines their distinctive character and intense fruit flavor. The grapes soak up sun in the afternoon and are cooled by evening fog. They mature slowly, developing intense, pure fruit flavors unique to California Coastal vineyards. This Robert Mondavi Winery Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon is grown in Napa Valley, California and is a 2013 vintage. A complex blend of fresh blackberry, wild berry compote, cassis, dark cocoa powder, forest floor, all-spice, and sweet vanilla, with balancing acidity, make this a perfect cabernet sauvignon. This wine is 88% cabernet sauvignon, 8% cabernet franc, and 4% petite verdot.

column1: Robert Mondavi Private Selection Bourbon Barrel Aged Cabernet, Red Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: We craft this richly textured Robert Mondavi Private Selection Bourbon Barrel Aged Cabernet Sauvignon with Monterey fruit, picked at the peak of ripeness in our coastal vineyards. In a truly original alternative to traditional aging, we set aside a portion of the blend to age in a mix of new oak and used bourbon barrels. The new barrels give the wine its deep undertones of toasted oak. The used barrels - selected from a renowned Kentucky distillery - exude notes of vanilla and dried herbs, hinting at the fine bourbon that one graced these casks. The result is a bold, flavorful wine, unlike any other cabernet. It has flavors of ripe blackberry cobbler, blueberry pie, praline, and sweet vanilla custard with hints of brown sugar, caramel, mocha, coffee, and smoke. This red wine pairs well with Bourbon glazed ribs, a charcuterie board and strong cheeses.

column1: Paul Masson Dessert Marsala, Red Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: One of the most respected wineries in the industry, Paul Masson has been producing fine dessert wines since the end of the 19th century. Paul Masson uses an old-world method of aging in small oak casks, resulting in a smooth flavor and finish. These wines are available in the only carafe package in the industry. The appealing design is reusable and the flared neck makes handling and pouring easy. This marsala is sweet, slightly crisp, with a full nutty flavor complemented by a fragrant bouquet of citrus and pears. It is a beautiful, deep amber color perfect for an after dinner drink.

Through a meticulous winemaking process, each of our wines is crafted to be food-friendly, fruit-forward and easy-to-drink. One 3-liter box contains the same amount of wine as four 750ml bottles, is 40% less expensive than comparable bottled wines, and stays fresh for six weeks after opening. Our Black Box Wines Shiraz boasts blackberry and cocoa aromas with hints of vanilla and tobacco. Flavors of dark cherry and oak complement full-bodied tannins and a rich, lasting finish. This delicious red wine is the perfect complement for grilled meats and vegetables.

column2: Mark West Wines accepts nothing less than the best, which is why the fruit for the wines is sourced from the finest vineyards throughout California. At Mark West, there's nothing more important than sharing a passion for pinot with others.

column1: Vendange Sauvignon Blanc, White Wine, 1.5 L Bottle
column2: Established as one of America’s best-selling wines, Vendange offers a selection of well-balanced and high-quality varietal wines at reasonable prices. Easily recognized by its elegant and distinctive triangle-shaped label, Vendange is the ideal wine for entertaining or enjoying with a meal at home. With its fruit-forward varietal characteristics, Vendange wine is perfect for everyday consumption.  Light yellow with pale green undertones, the nose is ripe with grassy citrus and herbs. A character of balanced acid leads into lemongrass and melon flavors that transcend to an enjoyable finish.

column2: The unique geography and climate of the California coast are what allows Robert Mondavi Wines to grow a variety of delicious grapes that give the wines their distinctive character and intense fruit flavor. column1: Mark West Pinot Grigio, White Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: Mark West Wines accepts nothing less than the best, which is why the fruit for the wines is sourced from the finest vineyards throughout California. Small-lot winemaking techniques are used to express the unique characteristics of each terroir. We choose grapes with bright, ripe fruit flavors and crisp acidity—everything you look for in a Pinot Grigio. After the night and early morning harvesting, the grapes were destemmed and crushed. Crisp and clean, this wine features honeydew, stone fruit, and citrus with a subtle, clean, lingering finish. It pairs well with fish and chips, summer salads, and steamed clams.

column1: Kim Crawford Rose, Blush Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: Kim Crawford's philosophy on making good wine is simple: focus on flavor. With grapes grown between the latitudes of 34 and 47 degrees, Kim Crawford's growing regions cover a distance of 1,000 miles from the northern tip of New Zealand to the southern coast. Within these regions the climates vary and allow winemakers to select from an assortment of grapes producing diverse and flavorful wines Kim Crawford is known for. Soft and luscious, this refreshing Kim Crawford Rosé is richly fruited with hints of watermelon and strawberry. This blush wine has a lively nose aroma, brimming with bright berry and tropical fruit. Ideal as an apéritif or summer sipper, this easy-drinking wine also pairs perfectly with lighter salads and other fare.

column1: Kim Crawford Chardonnay, White Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: Kim Crawford's philosophy on making good wine is simple: focus on flavor. With grapes grown between the latitudes of 34 and 47 degrees, Kim Crawford's growing regions cover a distance of 1,000 miles from the northern tip of New Zealand to the southern coast. Within these regions the climates vary and allow winemakers to select from an assortment of grapes producing diverse and flavorful wines Kim Crawford is known for. Kim Crawford Chardonnay is an approachable and full-bodied white wine that shows great length and persistence. It is medium weight with aromas of ripe tropical fruits—pineapple and ripe melon—with hints of butterscotch, and tastes of ripe stone fruit, butterscotch, and citrus. This white wine pairs well with Camembert cheese, pan-seared salmon, or other white meat dishes.

column1: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi Red Blend, Red Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: As the central valley heats up, cool maritime breezes are drawn across Woodbridge's Lodi region winery creating a Mediterranean-like climate of warm days and cool nights ideal for growing premium grapes. By using state-of-the-art technology for winemaking, employing unique growing techniques, and cultivating relationships with the local growers, Woodbridge is able to help ensure high quality grapes that would produce excellent wines. Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi Red Blend combines a deliciously rich, full-bodied blend of warm, toasty aromas and flavors, including jammy blackberry, vanilla, and baking spices. This red wine is full and rich with a long, flavorful finish. Our hearty Red Blend pairs well with savory dishes like burgers, barbeque, sausages, potato skins, and other fried foods. Fine wines for everyday enjoyment, since 1979.

column1: Robert Mondavi Private Selection Cabernet Sauvignon, Red Wine, 2 pk 1.5 L Bottles
column2: Robert Mondavi Private Selection was founded in 1994 by Robert Mondavi to capture the delicious flavors from California's best coastal vineyards. He inherently recognized the Central Coast's potential to produce phenomenal grapes - and, ultimately, wines of the utmost quality - at a more accessible price. They exude the fresh fruit character and bright acidity that can only come from a wine by the influence of the Pacific Ocean. This cabernet sauvignon has flavors of ripe Bing cherries, blackberries, and plum with vanilla, toasty oak, and hints of coffee. It has aromas of red berry and spice, juicy cherry, black current and black pepper. This red wine pairs well with roasted or grilled meats, hearty pasta, and strong cheese.

column1: The Dreaming Tree Cabernet Sauvignon, Red Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: An exciting collaboration between musician Dave Matthews and winemaker Sean McKenzie, The Dreaming Tree captures the spirit of California's wine country. At The Dreaming Tree, our winemaker repeatedly demonstrates his ability to preserve California’s most prestigious growing regions and their respective styles through the portfolio’s stellar lineup. The Dreaming Tree winery is a Certified California Sustainable Winegrowing winery, which is part of the California Sustainable Winegrowing Alliance third-party Certification Program promoting sustainable practices. This California Cabernet Sauvignon highlights classic aromas of blackberry, cherry, and toasted caramel. The wine has the structure you expect from Cabernet Sauvignon, but is also elegant and supple. It's an easy-drinking red wine with a lot of character. It displays classic aromas of blackberry, cherry, and cassis wraped in toasted caramel and soft, mouth-filling tannins, it's elegant and supple. Delicious with grilled flank steak, beef brisket, or portabella burgers as a vegetarian option. Varietal: 83% cabernet sauvignon, 8% merlot, 4% malbec, 4% tannat, 1% petit verdot. Appellation: California (50% North Coast, 28% Central Coast).

This California Red Blend brings juicy red fruit with  mid-palate weight from the merlot, raspberry jam flavors from the zinfandel, and dark fruit and structure from the Petit Syrah and Tannat. Its blend of coastal California varieties results in a tasty, complex red wine with lots of fruit flavors, some vanilla and mocha, and a long, soft finish. Delicious with Vietnamese-style pork sandwiches or vegetarian stuffed poblano peppers. Appellation: California (67% North Coast, 13% Central Coast). column1: Ruffino Il Ducale DOC Pinot Grigio, White Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: Producing the best Tuscan wines means having access to the best vineyards. With this in mind, Ruffino has, over the years, assembled a collection of top estates in Tuscany's most important fine wine appellations. Starting with the best quality fruit, Ruffino wines reveal themselves without coaxing or manipulation. This is the essence of Ruffino's traditional approach to making wine. Ruffino IL Ducale Pinot Grigio Fruili Doc is fresh and fragrant with bright aromas. The acidity is firm but balanced, working very well with the ripe fruit taste profile and confers freshness and a mineral touch to the wine. Pairs well with fresh seafood salad, linguine, spinach gnocchi and tomato bruschetta.

column1: J. Roget Spumante, White Sparkling Wine, 187 mL Bottle
column2: J Roget Spumante American sparkling wine is a beautiful straw color. 100% stainless steel tanks are used for the base wine and then secondary fermentation takes place in the Charmat tanks. This process preserves the fruit character, making a fresher, more flavorful wine. This American sparkling wine is medium-dry with crisp fruit flavors. The aromas of apple and pear are balanced with a bouquet of toasty yeast notes and floral nuances. This sparkling wine is sweet with outstanding fruit flavor and a long smooth finish. Blends beautifully into full-flavored cocktails. Alcohol 9.5%.

To open: (1) chill well, (2) do not shake, (3) point bottle away from self and others, (4) remove hood, (5) twist stopper out slowly by hand.  NEVER use a cork remover or reinsert stopper.

column1: Ravenswood Old Hill Vineyard Zinfandel, Red Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: Ravenswood wines capture the spirit of California’s Sonoma Valley appellation best growing regions and the popular Vintners Blend bottlings sourced from vineyards throughout California. Ravenswood strives to put what is picked from the fields right into the bottle. From Dry Creek, north of Healdsburg to the edge of the bay of the Carneros Valley, founder Joel Peterson has forged strong bonds with a cadre of grape growers who share Ravenswood's commitment and stubborn independence. Aged 19 months in French oak barrels, this zinfandel is refined and reserved yet assertive. It displays aromas of red fruit, dried flowers, anise, and bramble spice. It as firm but very fine tannins, leading to a long enjoyable finish and terrific aging potential. Varietal: 96.8% zinfandel, 3.2% mixed blacks.

column1: Nobilo Marlborough Sauvignon Blanc, White Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: Nobilo vineyards are primarily located in Marlborough, New Zealand appellation. Care has been taken to plant vines in the most welcoming spots with ideal soil ensuring the grapes benefit from the best these wine-growing regions have to offer. Nobilo wines are consistently fresh, bright, and balanced. Each bottle of Nobilo is a promise of New Zealand winemaking at its finest. This sauvignon blanc is vibrant and refreshing with tropical fruit flavors like pineapple, elderflower, cantaloupe, citrus, and herbal notes. Always fresh and crisp. Enjoyable on its own as an apéritif or with lemon herb chicken, summer salads, or lighter seafood dishes. Varietal: 100% sauvignon blanc.

column1: Estancia Reserve Meritage, Red Wine, 375 mL Bottle
column2: Estancia's vineyard lies in the Thermal Rainbow of Monterey County appellation, which features midday heat tempered by morning and late-afternoon fog-perfect for developing the intense fruit character. Pinnacles Vineyard was one of the first vineyards in California to be planted with a permanent irrigation system. This meritage red wine displays a rich, exquisite mouthfeel, velvety tannins, and ripe fruit balanced with notes of chocolate and French vanilla. Pairs well with steak, poultry, cauliflower, fruit and seafood. Varietal: 55% cabernet sauvignon, 22% merlot, 18% petit verdot, 5% malbec.

column1: Ruffino Alauda Toscana IGT, Red Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: Producing the best Tuscan wines means having access to the best vineyards. With this in mind, Ruffino has, over the years, assembled a collection of top estates in Tuscany's most important fine wine appellations. Starting with the best quality fruit, Ruffino wines reveal themselves without coaxing or manipulation. This is the essence of Ruffino's traditional approach to making wine.  Intense aromas of ripe red fruits with complex secondary aromatics of balsamic and vanilla. Rich with varietal flavors of plum and cherry from the merlot and layered with ripe berry flavors from the cabernet franc, unique balsamic and dark chocolate notes from the colorino. Pairs well with savory dishes such as bistecca piorentina, tortelli with duck sauce, risotto with sausage and lamb shoulder as well as rich aged or peppered cheeses. Varietal: 40% cabernet franc, 35% merlot, 25% colorino.

column1: Manischewitz Cream White Concord Kosher, White Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: The Manischewitz winery is located in Canandaigua, New York, and is best known for its budget concord wine. It is aged in steel tanks at cold temperatures to maintain fruit aromas. This sweet wine has a pleasant mouth feel and a smooth aftertaste with plenty of grape flavor and a subtle aroma of confectionery flavors. The crisp acidity balances the sweetness and up front fruit aromas. The natural fruitiness allows this wine to be served chilled. Goes wonderfully with fruit salad and grilled poultry.

column1: SIMI Alexander Valley Landslide Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon, Red Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: SIMI owns vineyards in two small and specialized sub-districts of Sonoma County-the warmer Alexander Valley, and the cooler, foggier Russian River Valley. SIMI made its first wine from Sonoma County grapes in 1876 and has been continuously making wine in the same stone cellar in Healdsburg, California since 1890. On the palate of this cabernet sauvignon are red berries, cassis, blackberry, and plum. This red wine is structured and elegant with balanced acidity, finishing with supple, ripe tannins and bittersweet cocoa. Pairs well with wood-grilled rib-eye with braised wild mushrooms, lamb loin with red pepper and onions, or pappardelle pasta with tomato and black pepper ragu. Varietal: 77% cabernet sauvignon, 9% cabernet franc, 6% merlot, 5% petit verdot, 2% malbec, 1% tannat.

column1: SIMI Alexander Valley Cabernet Sauvignon, Red Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: SIMI owns vineyards in two small and specialized sub-districts of Sonoma County-the warmer Alexander Valley, and the cooler, foggier Russian River Valley. SIMI made its first wine from Sonoma County grapes in 1876 and has been continuously making wine in the same stone cellar in Healdsburg, California since 1890. In this cabernet sauvignon red wine, toasty oak frames and adds depth to dark fruit aromas of blackberry, plum, and black cherry, leading into intriguing notes of cocoa, cassis, pepper berry, and cedar.Pairs well with grilled steaks with roasted mushrooms, Moroccan spiced lamb, and braised duck breast with carrot puree. Appellations: Alexander Valley 85%, Sonoma Valley 10%, Dry Creek Valley 5%. Varietal: 85% cabernet sauvignon, 10% merlot, 3% cabernet franc, 2% petot verdot, 1% malbec.

column1: SIMI Sonoma County Chardonnay, White Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: SIMI owns vineyards in two small and specialized sub-districts of Sonoma County-the warmer Alexander Valley, and the cooler, foggier Russian River Valley. SIMI made its first wine from Sonoma County grapes in 1876 and has been continuously making wine in the same stone cellar in Healdsburg, California since 1890. In this chardonnay, the nose has expressive notes of pineapple, white peach, green apple, Meyer lemon, and orange blossom laced with hints of butter, toasty brioche, and smoke. Pairs well with smoked salmon, prawns, or a caprese salad. Appellations: 25% Russian River Valley, 26% Carneros, 27% Alexander Valley, 22% Sonoma Coast. Varietal: 100% chardonnay.

column1: SIMI Sonoma County Sauvignon Blanc, White Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: SIMI owns vineyards in two small and specialized sub-districts of Sonoma County-the warmer Alexander Valley where red Bordeaux varieties are grown, and the cooler, foggier Russian River Valley where the Goldfields Vineyard is planted with Chardonnay. SIMI made its first wine from Sonoma County grapes in 1876 and has been continuously making wine in the same stone cellar in Healdsburg, California since 1890. The wine opens with complex aromas of fresh straw, green papaya, lime leaf, pink grapefruit, green apple, lemon grass, honeysuckle, and wet stone. Refreshing, forward, zesty flavors of lime, lemon, grapefruit, white peach, and passion fruit follow. Pairs well with goat cheese ravioli, crab gazpacho, mussels provencal, or smoked salmon. Appellation: Sonoma County. Varietal: 98% sauvignon blanc, 2% semillon.
