column1: Ravenswood Sonoma County Besieged Red Blend, Red Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: Ravenswood wines capture the spirit of California’s Sonoma Valley appellation best growing regions and the popular Vintners Blend bottlings sourced from vineyards throughout California. Ravenswood strives to put what is picked from the fields right into the bottle. From Dry Creek, north of Healdsburg to the edge of the bay of the Carneros Valley, founder Joel Peterson has forged strong bonds with a cadre of grape growers who share Ravenswood's commitment and stubborn independence. Dark, rich, full flavors ignite your senses with blackberry, black cherry, and baking spices, resolving into a delicious, smooth, satisfying finish. Varietal: petite sirah, carignane, zinfandel, syrah, barbera, alicante bouschet, and mourvedre.

column1: Black Box Red Sangria, Red Wine, 3 L Box
column2: Made from grapes harvested in world-class appellations, Black Box Wines have won over 70 Gold Medals at wine competitions throughout the US and have been awarded over 34 Wine Enthusiast Best Buys. Through a meticulous winemaking process, each of our wines is crafted to be food-friendly, fruit-forward and easy-to-drink. One 3-liter box contains the same amount of wine as four 750ml bottles, is 40% less expensive than comparable bottled wines, and stays fresh for six weeks after opening. Our Black Box Wines' Red Sangria is refreshingly delicious with flavors of fresh berry and citrus. Hints of orange zest lead to a crisp, invigorating finish. Serve chilled or over ice with slices of your favorite fresh fruit!

column1: Richards Wild Irish Rose, Red Wine, 3 L Bottle
column2: Richards Wild Irish Rose is a strong but sweet wine that consistently delivers great taste. One of the first branded wines in America, Wild Irish Rose has been delivering quality, full-flavored, and fruity fortified wines for more than 50 years. The lambrusco and vinifera juices are cool fermented in stainless steel. The wine is then blended, sweetened, and fortified with citrus brandy. Wild Irish Rose 17% Red Wine is 100% pure grape wine. A proprietary blend of native New York grape juice and white grape juice is used. Special care is taken to preserve the delicate, concord grape taste profile and color. Balance: medium body and medium sweet. Fruit: concord grape character.

column1: Estancia Cabernet Sauvignon, Red Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: Estancia's vineyard lies in the Thermal Rainbow of Monterey County, which features midday heat tempered by morning and late-afternoon fog-perfect for developing the intense fruit character. Pinnacles Vineyard was one of the first vineyards in California to be planted with a permanent irrigation system. This Paso Robles appellation cabernet sauvignon opens with brambleberry and floral aromas with notes of tobacco and leather. Lavish, silky tannins mid-palate, complemented with black currant, vanilla, and dark chocolate flavors and a nice lingering finish. Pairs well with aged gouda or parmesan, salads, potatoes, steak and red sauce pasta. Varietal: 100% cabernet sauvignon.

column1: Estancia Chardonnay, White Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: Estancia's vineyard lies in the Thermal Rainbow of Monterey County appellation, which features midday heat tempered by morning and late-afternoon fog-perfect for developing the intense fruit character. Pinnacles Vineyard was one of the first vineyards in California to be planted with a permanent irrigation system. This chardonnay opens with aromas of honey and tropical fruits with hints of orange and pineapple. Rich and well balanced with a delicious, creamy-textured mid-palate of ripe fruit, orange, almond, and spice flavors that leads to a refreshing and smooth finish. Pairs well with smoked salmon, cream sauce pastas, poultry, pork and mushrooms. Varietal: 100% chardonnay.

column1: Manischewitz Cherry Kosher, Red Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: The Manischewitz winery is located in Canandaigua, New York, and is best known for its budget concord wine. It is aged in steel tanks at cold temperatures to maintain fruit aromas. Full-bodied and sweet but balanced, this wine has aromas and tastes reminiscent of fresh-baked cherry pie. The crisp acidity balances the sweetness and up front fruit aromas. The natural fruitiness allows this wine to be served chilled. Goes wonderfully with roasted meats with fruit sauces, or paired with cherry-based desserts.

column1: Thorn Napa Valley Merlot, The Prisoner Wine Company, Red Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: The Prisoner Wine Company takes an unconventional approach to winemaking by working with impassioned growers to source varietals from vineyards and appellations across California. Alongside a family of growers, The Prisoner winemaking team pushes boundaries as they craft a selection of unexpected, yet artful wines. This Thorn Merlot is sourced from acclaimed vineyard sites throughout the Napa Valley. The family of small vineyards offers vines of varying ages and regionality, lending to layers of character and complexity. Earthy aromas open up into cocoa, blackberry, cedar, and anise. It’s smooth with flavors of cherry, chocolate, vanilla, and a mild toastiness. The finish is long with balanced acidity. Varietal: 81% merlot; 19% blend of syrah, petite sirah, and malbec.

Alongside a family of growers, The Prisoner winemaking team pushes boundaries as they craft a selection of unexpected, yet artful wines. This Blindfold White Blend sources chenin blanc from a vineyard in Mendocino, and Grenache blanc, Roussanne, and Viognier from growers in Santa Barbara. This white wine is blended with white rhone and aromatic varieties-equally bold and intriguing. A luscious entry of toasted hazelnut and mandarin is balanced by bright acidity and minerality. Varietal: chardonnay, roussanne, viognier, chenin blanc, muscat and vermentino

column2: The Prisoner Wine Company takes an unconventional approach to winemaking by working with impassioned growers to source varietals from vineyards and appellations across California. Alongside a family of growers, The Prisoner winemaking team pushes boundaries as they craft a selection of unexpected, yet artful wines. Aged for 14 months in French oak barrels, The Snitch 2016 Napa Valley Chardonnay is a bright and rich wine, with a touch of roussanne. column1: Clos du Bois Lightly Bubbled Rose, Blush Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: Clos du Bois farms almost 800 acres in the vibrantly diverse wine regions of Sonoma County and Coastal California. Working with a family of trusted growers from some of the best vineyards, each vintage is crafted to achieve balance, intensity, and true varietal character. Clos du Bois Lightly Bubbled Rose is a refreshing new take on a Rose. This Rose brings together delightful flavors of fresh strawberry, apricot, and cranberry with a hint of bubbles. Serve chilled and enjoy for any occasion or whenever you want to relax and unwind.

column1: SIMI Sonoma County Dry Rose, Blush Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: SIMI owns vineyards in two small and specialized sub-districts of Sonoma County-the warmer Alexander Valley, and the cooler, foggier Russian River Valley. SIMI made its first wine from Sonoma County grapes in 1876 and has been continuously making wine in the same stone cellar in Healdsburg, California since 1890. This rose is forward and focused with lingering tart cherry and balanced acidity that invigorates the taste buds. It is nicely structured with a fleshy middle and lengthy finish. We recommend enjoying this refreshing, versatile wine as an aperitif, or paired with fresh flavors like summer salad with smoked chicken and mango.  Appellation: Sonoma County. Varietal: 67% cabernet sauvignon, 22% merlot, 8% malbec, 2% cabernet franc, 1% graciano.

column1: SIMI Alexander Valley Cabernet Sauvignon, Red Wine, 375 mL Bottle
column2: SIMI owns vineyards in two small and specialized sub-districts of Sonoma County-the warmer Alexander Valley, and the cooler, foggier Russian River Valley. SIMI made its first wine from Sonoma County grapes in 1876 and has been continuously making wine in the same stone cellar in Healdsburg, California since 1890. In this cabernet sauvignon red wine, toasty oak frames and adds depth to dark fruit aromas of blackberry, plum, and black cherry, leading into intriguing notes of cocoa, cassis, pepper berry, and cedar.Pairs well with grilled steaks with roasted mushrooms, Moroccan spiced lamb, and braised duck breast with carrot puree. Appellations: Alexander Valley 85%, Sonoma Valley 10%, Dry Creek Valley 5%. Varietal: 85% cabernet sauvignon, 10% merlot, 3% cabernet franc, 2% petot verdot, 1% malbec.

column1: Ravenswood Vintners Blend Zinfandel, Red Wine, 1.5 L Bottle
column2: Ravenswood wines capture the spirit of California’s Sonoma Valley appellation best growing regions and the popular Vintners Blend bottlings sourced from vineyards throughout California. Ravenswood strives to put what is picked from the fields right into the bottle. From Dry Creek, north of Healdsburg to the edge of the bay of the Carneros Valley, founder Joel Peterson has forged strong bonds with a cadre of grape growers who share Ravenswood's commitment and stubborn independence. Big, bold Vintners Blend wines are crafted for those who refuse to flock to the latest fad. This zinfandel is a not-too-dry, medium-bodied, juicy, red wine with ripe raspberry, boysenberry, and bramble. Varietal: 76% zinfandel, 21% petite sirah, and 3% mixed blacks.

column1: Thorn Napa Valley Merlot, The Prisoner Wine Company, Red Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: The Prisoner Wine Company takes an unconventional approach to winemaking by working with impassioned growers to source varietals from vineyards and appellations across California. Alongside a family of growers, The Prisoner winemaking team pushes boundaries as they craft a selection of unexpected, yet artful wines. This Thorn Merlot is sourced from acclaimed vineyard sites throughout the Napa Valley. The family of small vineyards offers vines of varying ages and regionality, lending to layers of character and complexity. Earthy aromas open up into cocoa, blackberry, cedar, and anise. It’s smooth with flavors of cherry, chocolate, vanilla, and a mild toastiness. The finish is long with balanced acidity. Varietal: 81% merlot; 19% blend of syrah, petite sirah, and malbec.

column1: Taylor Country Cellars, White Wine, 3 L Bottle
column2: Over 115 years of Taylor family winemaking experience goes into every bottle. Leveraging the heritage and tradition of the highly-acclaimed Taylor brand, Taylor Country Cellars apply the same care and craftsmanship to its wine making technique. This American appellation white is a dry blend that is best when served cold. From its straw yellow color to its mellow fruit character, apple, pear, and melon aromas and flavors are delivered in a well-balanced, medium-bodied and smooth wine. It makes a great everyday wine to grace the table and pairs well with many dishes such as chicken, pasta, and seafood. Maintains peak flavor if refrigerated after opening and consumed within 14 days of opening.

Blackstone sources grapes from over 100 carefully selected vineyards in California’s appellation. column1: Red Guitar Tempranillo Garnacha, Red Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: The prized old vines of Tempranillo and Garnacha dig deep into the gravel soils of Navarra, Spain, to produce wines of incredible character and quality, year after year. Blended together, each vintage in equal portions, winemakers craft a fruity and concentrated wine made in a vibrant “New World” style. Tempranillo produces wines that have a wonderfully complex bouquet of cherries, leather, and even a touch of earthiness. Garnacha produces wines of great concentration, with explosive raspberry fruit characters and soft tannins. A rich and smooth celebration of the Spanish lifestyle, la buena vida - the good life.

column1: Red Guitar Sangria, Red Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: Red Guitar Sangria embodies the light, refreshing taste of traditional sangrias. Premium red wine is delicately blended with natural citrus and fresh fruit flavors of orange, lemon, lime, and cherry, creating a delicious easy-to-drink sangria. Red Guitar Sangria has the perfect balance between wine and fruit. It is ideal for casual get-togethers, summer fiestas, or relaxing evenings at home. Bright and flavorful enough to enjoy on its own, it also pairs perfectly with your favorite tapas and entrees. A rich and smooth celebration of the Spanish lifestyle, la buena vida - the good life.

column1: Diseno Malbec, Red Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: Argentina’s best-known appellation, Mendoza, instills confidence plus consistency with every vintage sourced from the premium sub-regions Valle de Uco and Lujan de Cuyo. Inert, flavorless, colorless, and odorless gases preserve the wine as it is pushed through the barrels, eliminating oxidation and preventing spoilage. Diseno Malbec is a rich wine with an inviting bouquet of stone fruit. A hint of coffee compliments the blueberry, spice, and chocolate flavors. Pairs well with hard cheeses, paella or seafood risotto, spicy red sauces and beef. Varietal: 100% malbec.

It is perfect for any occasion from dinner parties to everyday enjoyment. Varietal: 78% merlot, 12% syrah, 7% petite sirah, 3% other red varietals.

column1: Richards Wild Irish Rose, Red Wine, 375 mL Bottle
column2: Richards Wild Irish Rose is a strong but sweet wine that consistently delivers great taste. One of the first branded wines in America, Wild Irish Rose has been delivering quality, full-flavored, and fruity fortified wines for more than 50 years. The lambrusco and vinifera juices are cool fermented in stainless steel. The wine is then blended, sweetened, and fortified with citrus brandy. Wild Irish Rose 17% Red Wine is 100% pure grape wine. A proprietary blend of native New York grape juice and white grape juice is used. Special care is taken to preserve the delicate, concord grape taste profile and color. Balance: medium body and medium sweet. Fruit: concord grape character.

column1: Monkey Bay Sauvignon Blanc, White Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: Monkey Bay wines are full of easy-drinking style and charm reflecting New Zealand’s laid-back lifestyle, they’re perfect for any social occasion. The New Zealand appellation grapes enjoy a long, even ripening season, developing the lovely fresh fruit flavors you’ll find in Monkey Bay Sauvignon Blanc. When drinking this sauvignon blanc you are transported to paradise with aromas of vibrant grapefruit, kiwi, and pineapple with a hint of fresh cut grass. This sauvignon blanc is a fresh, lively approachable wine overflowing with grapefruit, lemon, and passionfruit, and infused with a delicate, herbaceous character. Great on its own or pair it with chicken, sea bass, or shellfish, this wine is perfect for summer. Varietal: 100% sauvignon blanc.

column1: Franciscan Napa Valley Magnificat Meritage, Red Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: Founded in 1973, Franciscan has a long tradition of crafting wine with a highly meticulous approach. Franciscan's home estate is located in Oakville, right in the heart of the Napa Valley appellation. This 240-acre parcel of land features loamy, gravelly, well-draining soil which adds structure to the wines. At Franciscan Estate, the wine lots are kept separate from the vineyard until just before bottling. After picking by hand, every load of grapes is assigned its own tank. Magnificat spent 20 months in oak, which led the aromas to trigger a mountain forest: sage, jasmine, truffle and cherry wood. Flavors of juicy dark fruit, rich toffee notes and dark-roasted coffee fill the palate. Varietal: 75% cabernet sauvignon, 17% merlot, 5% malbec, 2% petit verdot and 1% cab franc.

column1: Franciscan Chardonnay, White Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: Founded in 1973, Franciscan has a long tradition of crafting wine with a highly meticulous approach. Franciscan's home estate is located in Oakville, right in the heart of the Napa Valley (57% Monterey County, 43% Napa County) appellation. This 240-acre parcel of land features loamy, gravelly, well-draining soil which adds structure to the wines. At Franciscan Estate, the wine lots are kept separate from the vineyard until just before bottling. After picking by hand, every load of grapes is assigned its own tank. This chardonnay has aromas of bright fruit, minerals, and honeyed pear-apple. A bright and vibrant palate shows rich flavors evoking apple galette, honey, and creamy vanilla bean. Varietal: 100% chardonnay.

column1: Estancia Zinfandel, Red Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: Estancia's vineyard lies in the Thermal Rainbow of Monterey County, which features midday heat tempered by morning and late-afternoon fog - perfect for developing the intense fruit character. Pinnacles Vineyard was one of the first vineyards in the Paso Robles appellation to be planted with a permanent irrigation system. This zinfandel displays densely packed black raspberry, dark chocolate and cinnamon flavors followed by a long, rich finish. Enjoy and indulged with friends for an unforgettable food and wine experience. Varietal: 100% zinfandel.

column29: SPARKLING WARNING: BE CAREFUL! Point bottle away from self and others to avoid serious eye injury. To open: (1) chill well, (2) do not shake, (3) point bottle away from self and others, (4) remove hood, (5) twist stopper out slowly by hand.  NEVER use a cork remover or reinsert stopper.

column1: Mount Veeder Napa Valley Cabernet Sauvignon, Red Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: Mount Veeder Winery was the first vineyard in the Napa Valley appellation to have all five of the grape varieties used in a classic Bordeaux blend. Mount Veeder Winery feels that blending is the key to crafting the most complete, balanced wine. Artisanal winemaking skills, beginning with gentle handling in the vineyard and finishing with extended barrel aging in the cellar, ensure the wines are enjoyable upon release, yet capable of graceful aging. Vibrant berry and dark chocolate flavors blend with black peppercorn and graphite to create a complex and full palate. The rich, velvety structure delivers a smooth and seamless finish of cassis, blackberry pie, and rosemary. Aromas of deep cherry, plum, and vanilla intertwine with beautiful hints of anise and caramel. Varietal: 83% cabernet sauvignon, 11% merlot, 3% petit verdot, 2% malbec, 1% cabernet franc.

Artisanal winemaking skills, beginning with gentle handling in the vineyard and finishing with extended barrel aging in the cellar, ensure the wines are enjoyable upon release, yet capable of graceful aging. column2: Mount Veeder Winery was the first vineyard in the Napa Valley appellation to have all five of the grape varieties used in a classic Bordeaux blend. Mount Veeder Winery feels that blending is the key to crafting the most complete, balanced wine. Artisanal winemaking skills, beginning with gentle handling in the vineyard and finishing with extended barrel aging in the cellar, ensure the wines are enjoyable upon release, yet capable of graceful aging. Dark garnet in color with aromas of intricately woven dense black currant, black peppercorn, and cardamom lend a very deep and complex aroma. A bursting palate, with a big mouthfeel and structure, stuffed with dark cherry and plum. A powerful flavor wine with grace and restraint, it finishes long with black currant and savory notes. Varietal: 89% cabernet sauvignon, 7% malbec, 4% petit verdot.

column1: Franciscan Sauvignon Blanc, White Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: Founded in 1973, Franciscan has a long tradition of crafting wine with a highly meticulous approach. Franciscan's home estate is located in Oakville, right in the heart of the Napa Valley (57% Monterey County, 43% Napa County) appellation. This 240-acre parcel of land features loamy, gravelly, well-draining soil which adds structure to the wines. At Franciscan Estate, the wine lots are kept separate from the vineyard until just before bottling. After picking by hand, every load of grapes is assigned its own tank. This sauvignon blanc features bold and bright aromas, with notes of grapefruit, lime zest, and guava. It tastes of bright acidity with flavors of lime and pear with subtle minerality, and a round palate of lychee gives way to a clean finish. Varietal: 89% sauvignon blanc, 9% malvasia bianca, 1% chardonnay, 1% semillon.

column2: Mount Veeder Winery was the first vineyard in the Napa Valley appellation to have all five of the grape varieties used in a classic Bordeaux blend. Mount Veeder Winery feels that blending is the key to crafting the most complete, balanced wine. Artisanal winemaking skills, beginning with gentle handling in the vineyard and finishing with extended barrel aging in the cellar, ensure the wines are enjoyable upon release, yet capable of graceful aging. column1: Paso Creek Cabernet Sauvignon, Red Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: Paso Creek’s bold, juicy, full-bodied, and densely flavored wines provide a glimpse into the heartland of America. Small-lot winemaking and patient barrel aging complete the winemaking picture and enhance the robust and bold character of this Paso Robles appellation cabernet sauvignon. Well balanced with firm structure and toasty oak, this cabernet sauvignon's flavor is deeply concentrated with spicy fruit and a touch of chocolate followed by a rich, lingering finish. This red wine is dark garnet with a cherry hue along with complex aroma layers of black cherry, vanilla, dried fruit, and black pepper with a hint of cigar box. Big, bold, muscular red wines meant to be enjoyed.

column2: Traditional dessert wines that are perfect for any culinary application, Cribari offers a range of premium flavors that add to any chef’s arsenal. column1: Cribari Tables Chablis, White Wine, 18 L Box
column2: In 1904, Benjamin Cribari and his three sons took a chance on 40 acres of land in the foothills of Santa Clara County and established the “House of Cribari” line of wines. Using the same care and craftsmanship as they did over a century ago, Cribari offers an exciting selection of distinctive, classic, quality table wines. This American appellation wine was fermented at 70 degrees and aged in stainless steel tanks to maintain varietal fruit character. Apple, pear, and melon aromas and flavors are delivered in a well-balanced, medium bodied, and smooth wine. This is a great everyday wine to grace the table and pairs well with many chicken dishes and pasta with seafood.

column1: Robert Mondavi Private Selection Cabernet Sauvignon, Red Wine, 375 mL Bottle
column2: Robert Mondavi Private Selection was founded in 1994 by Robert Mondavi to capture the delicious flavors from California's best coastal vineyards. He inherently recognized the Central Coast's potential to produce phenomenal grapes - and, ultimately, wines of the utmost quality - at a more accessible price. They exude the fresh fruit character and bright acidity that can only come from a wine by the influence of the Pacific Ocean. This cabernet sauvignon has flavors of ripe Bing cherries, blackberries, and plum with vanilla, toasty oak, and hints of coffee. It has aromas of red berry and spice, juicy cherry, black current and black pepper. This red wine pairs well with roasted or grilled meats, hearty pasta, and strong cheese.

column1: Simply Naked Chardonnay, White Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: Simply Naked wines reveal themselves as they really are, without being hidden by the flavor of oak. By choosing not to oak-age our wines, we are allowing the crisp fruit flavor and the true varietal characteristics to shine through. We start with the best quality fruit from California’s appellation and manage the entire process very carefully. It takes a lot of discipline but it's worth it in the end when you have a great tasting wine in the bottle. This chardonnay has tropical fruit, citrus, and pear notes with layers of melon, fig, and a touch of honey. It pairs well with chicken, salmon, turkey, and pasta.

column1: Primal Roots Red Blend, Red Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: Primal Roots uses fruit from California’s appellation, harvested, crushed, destemmed, and cold-soaked for three days to allow juice/skin contact before fermentation. This process yields a deep color, rich texture, and more concentrated fruit flavors. The finished blend captures all of the wild, sweet, and intense flavors. Its rich, balanced texture makes you want to explore its many layers. Aromas of black cherry, plum, black currant, caramel, and hints of dark chocolate give way to a full bodied red blend with a soft entry, balanced fruit and tannins, and a lingering ripe cocoa finish. The rich core of black cherry, dark fruit, and spicy oak are truly uninhibited. Varietal: 34% syrah, 30% merlot, 20% zinfandel.

column1: V.NO Sauvignon Blanc, White Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: The best wines are crafted from grapes grown in the environment that's just right for them. V.No quality wines are sourced from around the world, transporting consumers to places and memories they cherish, or helping them discover a new experience.  V.No's varietals are carefully selected as the most genuine example of a local wine to provide a perfectly authentic experience. V.No Sauvignon Blanc is from New Zealand, because no one does Sauvignon Blanc better than New Zealand. This New Zealand appellation sauvignon blanc is mouthwatering and medium bodied with flavors of bright lime and passion fruit. This wine pairs well with flaky white fish, oysters, ceviche, risotto with scallops, and citrus-marinated chicken.

column1: Tom Gore Vineyards Sauvignon Blanc, White Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: For Tom Gore, farming isn’t a profession; it’s a way of life. His family helped develop the vineyards of Northern California appellation into a world-class winemaking region. Tom grows his grapes using meticulous farming techniques, and works closely with winemakers. Together, they taste the wines at various stages throughout their development and collaborate on the blending process. Fermented in 100% stainless steel, our sauvignon blanc opens with fresh squeezed lime and grapefruit rind aromas, with hints of tangerine and white flowers. The mouthwatering citrus fruit carries through the palate of this white wine and finishes with a crisp acidity. Varietal: 93% sauvignon blanc, 7% French colombard.

column1: Tom Gore Vineyards Reserve Alexander Valley Cabernet Sauvignon, Red Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: For Tom Gore, farming isn’t a profession; it’s a way of life. His family helped develop the vineyards of Northern California appellation into a world-class winemaking region. Tom grows his grapes using meticulous farming techniques, and works closely with winemakers. Together, they taste the wines at various stages throughout their development and collaborate on the blending process. Aged 18 months in oak barrels, our cabernet sauvignon reserved has a deep, dark purple color. The aroma is full with concentrated cassis and blackberry fruit, complemented by tobacco, cocoa, and a touch of caramel toasted oak. A sweet entry and intense blackcurrant and black cherry fruit complemented by sweet oak tannins. The wine has structure with dense tannins and supple texture. The finish is full and lingering. Varietal: 99% cabernet sauvignon, 1% petit verdot.

column1: Ravage Cabernet Sauvignon, Red Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: Ravage answers the call for interesting with a wine that tempts the taste buds with its dark, decadent flavors and smooth structure. It is a wine as complex as those who drink it. The 2015 vintage came in fast and early. Solid canopies and low tonnage help flavors come into balance, which result in concentrated wines that showed true varietal characteristics. Flavors are dark, rich, and audacious. Layered notes of dark berries, luscious vanilla and mocha, complemented by soft tannins and a smooth mouthfeel. Perfect for pairing with seasoned grilled steak, BBQ ribs, or sipping on its own. Varietal: 76% cabernet sauvignon, 10% merlot, 10% zinfandel, 3% syrah, 1% other reds.

column1: Cooper and Thief Bourbon Barrel Aged Red Blend, Red Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: While other wines celebrate doing the same thing for centuries, Cooper and Thief celebrates doing things differently. Cooper and Thief's bourbon barrel-aged red wine blend challenges tradition, which makes for a much more interesting story. Crafted in California’s appellation, Cooper and Thief wine is aged for three months in bourbon whiskey barrels, which gives way to soft, velvety tannins with a subtle heat. The combined result is a rich flavor, with a long, lingering finish. This red blend is a complex, smooth, and rounded wine. Hints of bourbon on the finish are complemented by dark, jammy fruits, toasty vanilla, and floral notes. It pairs well with beef, lamb, veal, and poultry. Varietal: 31% syrah, 28% merlot, 20% zinfandel, 14% petite sirah, 3% malbac, 4% other red blends.

column1: Cooper and Thief Napa Valley Tequila Aged Sauvignon Blanc, White Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: Crafted in Napa Valley’s appellation, Cooper and Thief Cellarmasters Sauvignon Blanc is aged for three months in Casa Noble anejo tequila barrels, which gives way to soft, velvety tannins with a subtle heat. The combined result creates an unusual richness in the structure, balanced with refreshing acidity and a long, lingering finish. Cooper and Thief Sauvignon Blanc is a rich white wine full of aromatic fruit characters, with classic citrus and spice notes reminiscent of fine blue agave tequila, giving way to toasty vanilla flavors from the barrels. It pairs well with seafood and chicken dishes. Varietal: 78% sauvignon blanc, 12% French colombard, 10% semillon and other whites.

column1: The Prisoner Napa Valley Red Blend, The Prisoner Wine Company, Red Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: The Prisoner Wine Company takes an unconventional approach to winemaking by working with impassioned growers to source varietals from vineyards and appellations across California. Alongside a family of growers, The Prisoner winemaking team pushes boundaries as they craft a selection of unexpected, yet artful wines. This red blend is aged in a combination of French and American oak barrels, 30% new. This is the blend that started it all and challenged how wine should be made. It features enticing aromas of Bing cherry, dark chocolate, clove, and roasted fig. Persistent flavors of ripe raspberry, boysenberry, pomegranate, and vanilla linger harmoniously, for a smooth and luscious finish. Varietal: zinfandel, cabernet sauvignon, petite sirah, syrah, charbono.

column2: The Prisoner Wine Company takes an unconventional approach to winemaking by working with impassioned growers to source varietals from vineyards and appellations across California. The most concentrated and delicious lots of each variety were selected for the first vintage of Derange. After lot selection, all barrels destined for Derange were hand-selected by tasting each and every one. Aged 18 months in oak barrels, this red blend is full of black cherry, clove spice, blackberry cobbler, and vanilla toast. column1: Cuttings Napa Valley Cabernet Sauvignon, The Prisoner Wine Company, Red Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: The Prisoner Wine Company takes an unconventional approach to winemaking by working with impassioned growers to source varietals from vineyards and appellations across California. The resulting wines are interesting blends of distinct quality and character. Inspired by the age-old method of using cuttings from idyllic sites for the propagation of new vines, this cabernet sauvignon showcases some of The Prisoner Wine Company's favorite hillside vineyards. Aged for 18 months in French oak barrels, Cuttings combines deliciously smooth flavors of blueberry, dark cherry, and cocoa. This red wine has aromas of fresh roasted coffee, black currant, vanilla bean, brown spice, and wild berries. Varietal: 80% cabernet sauvignon, 20% blend of petite sirah, syrah, zinfandel.

column1: Saldo Zinfandel, The Prisoner Wine Company, Red Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: The Prisoner Wine Company takes an unconventional approach to winemaking by working with impassioned growers to source varietals from vineyards and appellations across California. Alongside a family of growers, The Prisoner winemaking team pushes boundaries as they craft a selection of unexpected, yet artful wines. We created Saldo to feature this outstanding fruit from Dry Creek, Lodi, and Amador, where zinfandel has thrived for decades. Dark ruby color with bold aromas of black licorice, black pepper, cherry, and baking spice. The entry is rich, full, and scintillating. The palate is mouthwatering and smooth with a hint of chocolate. The finish is voluptuous with soft, velvety tannins. Varietal: 85% zinfandel, 15% blend of petite sirah and syrah.

column2: Notable wines are carefully crafted to deliver delicious layers of flavor that you can see on the bottle and savor in the glass. This California appellation wine undergoes a malolactic fermentation to soften its acidity and enhance the smooth mouthfeel. The wine was aged for nine months with French oak, imparting toasty vanilla notes. Bright golden in color, this chardonnay opens with stone fruit and apple aromas. These are layered with baking spices and the essence of butter on a smooth palate of toasted vanilla oak, culminating in a vibrant finish. It’s delicious paired with risotto, shrimp, and halibut. column2: 7 Moons combines seven different grape varietals sourced from prime vineyards up and down California’s Central Coast appellation and Lodi regions, blended in perfect harmony. The resulting wines have superb color and show great depth, complexity, varietal intensity, and balance. This red blend opens with aromas of chocolate-covered cherries, baking spices, and vanilla bean. Flavors of strawberry preserves, cherry cola and milk chocolate follow through to a fruit-forward, lingering finish. It pairs well with barbecued chicken and caprese salad. column1: Spoken Barrel Meritage, Red Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: Spoken Barrel is born from the rugged growing conditions of Washington's Columbia Valley appellation. The red grape varieties from its top vineyards were destemmed and fermented warm on the skins in stainless steel tanks to extract flavor, color, and tannins. Black garnet in color, this meritage features bright, fresh fruit aromas of blueberry and red plum with dark notes of leather, black licorice, and deep roasted oak. A dense and rich mouthfeel is accented by flavors of bright red fruits, toasty oak, smoke, chocolate, and citrus rind. The ample tannins are supple and carry the flavors through a long finish. Spoken Barrel's high-quality wines are easy to pick out, open up, and share with confidence. Varietal: 45% malbec, 28% cabernet sauvignon, 14% merlot, 13% petit verdot.

column1: Robert Mondavi Winery Reserve Carneros Napa Chardonnay, White Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: The unique geography and climate of the California coast are what allows Robert Mondavi Wines to grow a variety of grapes that give the wines their distinctive character and intense fruit flavor. The grapes soak up sun in the afternoon and are cooled by evening fog. They mature slowly, developing intense, pure fruit flavors unique to California Coastal vineyards. This California appellation chardonnay has a commanding entry of ripe Asian pear, juicy red apple, lemon curd and marzipan flavors. The rich texture that fills the palate with voluminous flavor and leads them slowly into a long, lingering finish. Pairs well with Alaskan king grab, grilled salmon, or chicken marsala. Varietal: 100% chardonnay.

column1: Hidden Crush Chardonnay, White Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: Every vintage has a "hidden crush", a winemaker's careful selection of grapes from their favorite vineyards. The grapes used to craft Hidden Crush wines are hand-selected from individual lots on select Central Coast, California appellations. Each parcel is vinified separately to preserve its unique style, and every batch undergoes tank and barrel fermentation aged in oak for six to nine months until it is perfect. This chardonnay features aromas of lime, lemon blossom, green apple, pineapple, and white peach with bright fruit flavors, rich viscosity, refreshing crisp acidity, and lovely lingering flavors. Its bright citrus fruit flavors pairs well with delicate, subtle flavors, creams and cheese. Varietal: 100% chardonnay.

column1: Toasted Head Chardonnay, White Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: Handcrafting wines since 1995, Toasted Head's estate vineyards in Yolo's Dunnigan Hills. A designated American Viticultural Area on the eastern side of California's appellation perched on rolling hillsides with well-drained gravelly loam soils. Named for the age-old practice of toasting barrel heads with fire, which is what helps to create the distinct toasted flavors in all our wines. This chardonnay opens with layered aromas of baked apples, brown sugar, butterscotch, and toasted marshmallows. The palate is a rich display of warm vanilla bean cream, apple caramel, custard, and toasted macadamias. Varietal: 100% chardonnay.

column1: SIMI Reserve Russian River Valley Chardonnay, White Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: SIMI owns vineyards in two small and specialized sub-districts of Sonoma County-the warmer Alexander Valley, and the cooler, foggier Russian River Valley. SIMI made its first wine from Sonoma County grapes in 1876 and has been continuously making wine in the same stone cellar in Healdsburg, California since 1890. This Russian River Valley appellation chardonnay opens with exotic sandalwood and cardamom followed by toasted bread, lemon zest, green apple, nougat, tropical fruit, stone fruit, minerals and lush cream. The palate is warm with vanilla, toast, stone fruit, pineapple, orange zest, and Granny Smith and Golden Delicious apples. Pairs well with seared scallops, seared halibut or lobster bisque. Varietal: 100% chardonnay.

column1: Wild Horse Pinot Noir, Red Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: Situated at a midpoint in the Central Coast, the Templeton vineyard and winery location is ideal for sourcing fruit from vineyards north and south of the winery, along with its low-vigor soils, proven ground water table, and rural atmosphere. The varieties of soil composition and micro-climates that can be found within the expansive Central Coast appellation present the opportunity to cultivate the same varietal in a wide range of growing conditions. This Wild Horse pinot noir has complex aromas of ripe cherry, dark fruit, nutmeg, earth, strawberry pie, and vanilla. The flavors are fresh, balanced, and bright, including cranberry, strawberry, and vanilla. Pairs well  with roasted pork tenderloin or grilled salmon. Varietal: 100% pinot noir.

column1: Inniskillin Niagara Icewine VQA Vidal Gold, White Wine, 375 mL Bottle
column2: Inniskillin Icewine, recognized as one of the world’s great wines, is truly winter’s gift to wine lovers. Harvested at the pinnacle of Canada’s crisp winter, the grapes are naturally frozen on the vine and picked when the temperature drops to -10 degrees C. Only a few drops of luscious nectar can be squeezed from each bunch, which is then expertly guided through fermentation to achieve this rich and alluring specialty wine. This Niagara River appellation wine opens with abundant aromatics of apricot, peach and pineapple integrate well with the French oaks and flavors of mango, clove and orange peel. Pairs well with salted creme caramel or traditional creme brule, any ash aged cheeses, tarte tatin, Vidal French onion soup or caramelized onion tart. Serve chilled.

This Okanagan Valley appellation wine opens with a mix of honey, beeswax, and dried apricot on the nose with a tantalizing essence of honey and dried apricot on the palate as well. A well rounded mouthfeel with acidity that balances out this naturally sweet dessert wine. Pairs well with sushi, pad thai, chicken liver pate, seared scallops and poached pears with mascarpone. Serve chilled.

column1: Jackson Triggs Niagara Icewine Vidal, White Wine, 187 mL Bottle
column2: Established in 1993, Jackson-Triggs has become an expression of passion and commitment to creation of fine Canadian wines. In a state-of-the art facility, Jackson-Triggs utilizes a three-tiered gravity-flow assisted system to maximize quality and minimize harmful pumping. The most advanced equipment has been selected to provide an unprecedented level of flexibility and control in the winemaking process. This Niagara Peninsula appellation wine exhibits great aromatic intensity, with notes of tropical fruit, honeysuckle, and caramel. The nose translates well into the palate with more honey notes, papaya, apricot and mango leading to a silky and luscious finish. Pairs well with spicy Thai spring rolls, pork tenderloin, goat’s cheese and aged parmesan.

column1: Clos du Bois Alexander Valley Marlstone Cabernet Sauvignon, Red Wine, 1.5 L Bottle
column2: This Clos du Bois Marlstone is a Clos du Bois tradition, Sonoma County's first red Bordeaux-style blend. Sourced from benchland and mountain vineyards in Alexander Valley, this unique blending of different varietIes spend a minimum of 22 months in French oak barrels. This red wine has intense aromas of plum and violets, a deep ruby color and enticing flavors of mocha, spice and rich blackberry. Soft supple tannins, a rich mouthfeel and a long, silky finish provide a memorable ending to this luscious and expressive wine. Varietal: 72% cabernet sauvignon, 2% merlot, 5% petit verdot, 1% malbec, 1% cabernet franc.

column1: Inniskillin Niagara Icewine Riesling, White Wine, 375 mL Bottle
column2: Inniskillin Icewine, recognized as one of the world’s great wines, is truly winter’s gift to wine lovers. Harvested at the pinnacle of Canada’s crisp winter, the grapes are naturally frozen on the vine and picked when the temperature drops to -10 degrees C. Only a few drops of luscious nectar can be squeezed from each bunch, which is then expertly guided through fermentation to achieve this rich and alluring specialty wine. This Niagara River appellation wine opens with aromatics of fresh orange, spice, lemon and lime. On the palate this rich and elegant wine shows great texture with concentrated flavors of peach, apricot along with a hint of clove, balanced by a crisp and lively acidity. Pairs well with brie with lavender honey, firm aged cheddar, seared scallops or classic baked apples. Serve chilled.

column1: Ravenswood Napa Valley Zinfandel, Red Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: Ravenswood wines capture the spirit of California’s Sonoma Valley appellation best growing regions and the popular Vintners Blend bottlings sourced from vineyards throughout California. Ravenswood strives to put what is picked from the fields right into the bottle. From Dry Creek, north of Healdsburg to the edge of the bay of the Carneros Valley, founder Joel Peterson has forged strong bonds with a cadre of grape growers who share Ravenswood's commitment and stubborn independence. A brilliant example of Napa Valley zinfandel with heavy aromas of fresh red raspberry, cedar, mint, baking spice, and eucalyptus. There is a ripe, sweet fruit on the mid-palate with precise tannins and mouthwatering acidity. Varietal: 100% zinfandel.

column1: The Prisoner Napa Valley Red Blend, The Prisoner Wine Company, Red Wine, 1.5 L Bottle
column2: The Prisoner Wine Company takes an unconventional approach to winemaking by working with impassioned growers to source varietals from vineyards and appellations across California. Alongside a family of growers, The Prisoner winemaking team pushes boundaries as they craft a selection of unexpected, yet artful wines. This red blend is aged in a combination of French and American oak barrels, 30% new. This is the blend that started it all and challenged how wine should be made. It features enticing aromas of Bing cherry, dark chocolate, clove, and roasted fig. Persistent flavors of ripe raspberry, boysenberry, pomegranate, and vanilla linger harmoniously, for a smooth and luscious finish. Varietal: zinfandel, cabernet sauvignon, petite sirah, syrah, charbono.

column1: Rex Goliath Pinot Grigio, White Wine, 1.5 L Bottle
column2: At the turn of the 20th century, Rex Goliath, the “World’s Largest Rooster”, was the treasured attraction of a Texas circus. We honor Rex with our premium varietal wines. Mark Ferguson joined the team as a winemaker in 2011 and has added his expertise to every bottle ever since. He brings enthusiasm and comprehensive experience and works to continue the legacy of bold flavors and big personality for which the wines have become known. This American appellation pinot grigio has big citrus aromas with layers of fresh stone fruit and intense floral notes. Bright acidity is balanced with fresh citrus, leading to a crisp refreshing finish. This wine pairs especially well with seafood dishes like fresh fish tacos and steamed mussels with broth.

column1: La Terre Merlot, Red Wine, 1.5 L Bottle
column2: La Terre, which means “the earth” in French, is a tribute to the soil that nourishes the vine. At La Terre, the emphasis on grape quality is foremost in creating the wines. La Terre's winemaking philosophy is simple: ensure that every bottle of La Terre consistently expresses the varietal character of the grape with underlying complexity and richness. Medium to dark red in color, this American appellation merlot has aromas of cherries and blueberries with a slight herbal undertone. It is medium-bodied with strong fruit flavors and a soft finish.

column1: Meiomi Pinot Noir, Red Wine, 375 mL Bottle
column2: To create the unrivaled taste of Meiomi, we grow our grapes in three sought after regions along the California coast —Monterey, Sonoma, and Santa Barbara counties. Fruit from all three exceptional maritime regions is blended to create a richly layered, well-balanced, and expressive Pinot Noir. This red wine has complex aromas and flavors of strawberry and jammy, dark fruit and vanilla backed by depth and structure rare in a Pinot Noir. It pairs well with tomato-based pasta dishes and thin-crust pizza. Best enjoyed between 55–58°F.

column1: 240 Days Riesling, White Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: 240 Days represents the epitome of winemaker precision amid regional complexity, highlighting some of the best-quality wines the Finger Lakes have to offer. The grapes were whole-cluster pressed immediately after harvest to preserve their fresh, aromatic flavors. The juice was settled and racked into both temperature-controlled stainless steel and 6-year old, neutral French oak barrels. The two wines were blended to create this riesling. A stunning example of the Finger Lakes appellation signature varietal. This white wine shows expressive aromas of lime zest and white peach. The off-dry palate is crisp with zesty acidity and a long finish. Varietal: 100% riesling.

column1: 240 Days Cabernet Franc, Red Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: 240 Days represents the epitome of winemaker precision amid regional complexity, highlighting some of the best-quality wines the Finger Lakes have to offer. After a six-day cold, soak fermentation was started using FX 10 yeast. After fermentation, skin contact continued for another two and a half weeks to full round the palate and refine the tannins. Aged 14 months in French oak barrels this cabernet franc is an elegant, refined expression of the Finger Lakes appellation terroir. The highly perfumed nose shows aromas of blackberry, clove, and dry herb. The palate is refreshing with soft tannins on the long finish. Varietal: 100% cabernet franc.

column1: 240 Days Rose, Blush Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: 240 Days represents the epitome of winemaker precision amid regional complexity, highlighting some of the best-quality wines the Finger Lakes have to offer. The base of our Finger Lakes appellation rose wine was formed by a 20% saignee of the cabernet franc fruit. Then barrel fermented to dryness in 7-year old French oak barrels, adding length to the finish and balancing the weight. The nose is delicate and fruity with raspberries and red currants. The palate is lightly structured, crisp, and balanced, leading to a long finish. Varietal: 97% cabernet franc, 3% riesling.

column1: Double Diamond Oakville Cabernet Sauvignon, Red Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: In 2000, Fred Schrader created Double Diamond as part of his continuing quest to make the best cabernet sauvignon that Napa Valley appellation can offer. This unique expression of the region carries on the tradition of earning critical acclaim and drawing passionate fans. Aged 16 months in French oak barrels, Double Diamond Oakville Cabernet Sauvignon red wine opens with layered, intriguing aromas of black currants, dark cherries, blackberry, cherry compote, toast and oak spice. The palate is rich and juicy resulting in a big, bursting flavor. The tannin structure makes this a great wine to enjoy upon release, but it will also mellow nicely for the next two to six years. Varietal: 98% cabernet sauvignon, 2% merlot.

column1: Kim Crawford Favourite Homestead Pinot Gris, White Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: Kim Crawford's philosophy on making good wine is simple: focus on flavor. The exceptional grapes were selected from small batches and crafted into our Small Parcels range. With grapes grown between the latitudes of 34 degrees and 47 degrees, Kim Crawford's growing regions cover a distance of 1,000 miles from the northern tip of New Zealand to the southern coast. Within these regions the climates vary and allow winemakers to select from an assortment of grapes producing the diverse and flavorful wines Kim Crawford is known for. This Kim Crawford Favourite Homestead Pinot Gris is rich, textural and dry with aromas of pear, peach, and red apple layered with exotic spice. This white wine exhibits sumptuous concentration balanced by mouthwatering acidity. It pairs well with creamy pasta dishes, spicy shrimp, and summer salads.

column1: Auros Napa Valley Cabernet Sauvignon, Red Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: Auros is crafted with hand-selected fruit from a combination of vineyards blocks in our Napa Valley appellation. The grapes were hand-picked and hand-sorted, and then briefly cold soaked to enhance the extraction of vivid color from the cabernet fruit. The juice was kept in contact with the skins for two weeks to build rich, soft tannins in the wine. Aged in French oak barrels for 18 months, this cabernet sauvignon opens with dark fruit aromas of cassis, blackberry, and dried blueberry. The rich, full-bodied palate unveils layers of black currant jam, roasted coffee, tobacco, dried fig, and vanilla bean. Soft, supple tannins frame a plush velvety finish. Varietal: 77% cabernet sauvignon, 17% merlot, 3% petite verdot, 2% syrah, 1% cabernet franc.

column1: The Dreaming Tree Rose, Blush Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: An exciting collaboration between musician Dave Matthews and winemaker Sean McKenzie, The Dreaming Tree captures the spirit of California's wine country. At The Dreaming Tree, our winemaker repeatedly demonstrates his ability to preserve California’s most prestigious growing regions and their respective styles through the portfolio’s stellar lineup. The Dreaming Tree winery is a Certified California Sustainable Winegrowing winery, which is part of the California Sustainable Winegrowing Alliance third-party Certification Program promoting sustainable practices. This dry California Rosé offers delicate floral and tropical aromas and has a crisp, light body. With fresh flavors of watermelon, strawberry, and nectarine. This Rosé is versatile and pairs well with many options. Enjoy with grilled chicken salad, bruschetta, and berry tarts. Appellation: California. Varietal: 56% pinot noir, 23% grenache, 11% pinot grigio, 10% other varieties.

column2: Established over 70 years ago, in the vineyards of the Montagne de Reims region of Champagne, Palmer and Co. shared a desire for perfection. column1: Franciscan Napa Valley Reserve Merlot, Red Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: Founded in 1973, Franciscan has a long tradition of crafting wine with a highly meticulous approach. Franciscan's home estate is located in Oakville, right in the heart of the Napa Valley appellation. This 240-acre parcel of land features loamy, gravelly, well-draining soil which adds structure to the wines. At Franciscan Estate, the wine lots are kept separate from the vineyard until just before bottling. After picking by hand, every load of grapes is assigned its own tank. Franciscan Napa Valley Reserve Merlot red wine has aromas of pretty berry, sweet cherry vanilla, and milk chocolate. Soft and seamless, neatly woven with a velvety mouthfeel. Textured and rich, the flavors echo the aromas with anise, toffee and plum. Varietal: 93% merlot, 7% syrah.

column1: Franciscan Napa Valley Magnificat Meritage, Red Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: Founded in 1973, Franciscan has a long tradition of crafting wine with a highly meticulous approach. Franciscan's home estate is located in Oakville, right in the heart of the Napa Valley appellation. This 240-acre parcel of land features loamy, gravelly, well-draining soil which adds structure to the wines. At Franciscan Estate, the wine lots are kept separate from the vineyard until just before bottling. After picking by hand, every load of grapes is assigned its own tank. Franciscan Napa Valley Magnificat red wine opens with a beautiful nose of ripe, perfumed cherry, with notes of vanilla, dark berry, sandalwood and creme brulee. The smooth finish lingers with notes of ripe cherry, toasty oak, and bittersweet chocolate to the finish. Varietal: 70% cabernet sauvignon, 22% merlot, 4% petit verdot, 4% malbec.

column1: Cooper and Thief Napa Valley Rye Barrel Aged Cabernet Sauvignon, Red Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: While other wines celebrate doing the same thing for centuries, Cooper and Thief celebrates doing things differently. Cooper and Thief's barrel-aged red wine challenges tradition, which makes for a much more interesting story. Crafted in the Napa Valley appellation, Cooper and Thief Rye Barrel Aged Cabernet Sauvignon red wine is aged for six months in bourbon whiskey barrels, which gives way to warm, dark fruit aromas, and a lush mouthfeel. Supple tannins touched by hints of toasted rye spice, leaves complexity on the palate and finishes with a smooth structure reminiscent of a fine rye whiskey. Varietal: 80% cabernet sauvignon, 14% merlot, 4% cabernet franc, 2% petit verdot.

column1: Headlock Napa Valley Charbono, The Prisoner Wine Company, Red Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: The Prisoner Wine Company takes an unconventional approach to winemaking by working with impassioned growers to source varietals from vineyards and appellations across California. Alongside a family of growers, The Prisoner winemaking team pushes boundaries as they craft a selection of unexpected, yet artful wines. Headlock is a red wine that blends charbono with petite sirah and syrah. It is aged for twelve months in new and neutral oak barrels. Black plum and blueberry aromas with inviting cinnamon and vanilla notes. The palate is full with soft tannins and closely knit structure. Varietal: charbono, petite sirah, and syrah.

column1: Double Diamond Oakville Cabernet Sauvignon, Red Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: In 2000, Fred Schrader created Double Diamond as part of his continuing quest to make the best cabernet sauvignon that Napa Valley appellation can offer. This unique expression of the region carries on the tradition of earning critical acclaim and drawing passionate fans. Aged 16 months in French oak barrels, Double Diamond Oakville Cabernet Sauvignon red wine opens with layered, intriguing aromas of black currants, dark cherries, blackberry, cherry compote, toast and oak spice. The palate is rich and juicy resulting in a big, bursting flavor. The tannin structure makes this a great wine to enjoy upon release, but it will also mellow nicely for the next two to six years. Varietal: 98% cabernet sauvignon, 2% merlot.

column1: Drylands Sauvignon Blanc, White Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: Planted in 1980 in the esteemed Marlborough, New Zealand appellation, Drylands Home Block Vineyards is one of the oldest sauvignon blanc vineyards. Regarded as one of the pioneers of winemaking, Drylands continues to carry on its vision. Drylands Sauvignon Blanc opens with layers of passion fruit, fruit zest, and tropical fruit on the nose with a hint of elderflower. The palate offers juicy, weighty sweet fruit balanced with clean acidity. Concentrated citrus flavors with layers of passion fruit, pink grapefruit, and pomelo linger through the finish. This white wine pairs well with delicious seafood and poultry. Varietal: 100% sauvignon blanc.

column1: Robert Mondavi Private Selection Rye Barrel Aged Red Blend, Red Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: Robert Mondavi Private Selection Rye Barrel Aged Red Blend - the first-of-its-kind Red Blend aged in Rye barrels - reflects the expressive character of this truly original approach to aging. Our coastal vineyards deliver lush, dark fruit flavors of plum, black cherry and blackberry to the wine. A select portion of the blend is then aged in Rye Whiskey barrels, which add complex nuances of toasted oak and rye spice for a smooth, rich finish. This red wine pairs well with your favorite comfort food or charcuterie board.

column1: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi Rose, Blush Wine, 750 mL Bottle
column2: As the central valley heats up, cool maritime breezes are drawn across Woodbridge's Lodi region winery creating a Mediterranean-like climate of warm days and cool nights ideal for growing premium grapes. Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi Rose has delicate floral aromas along with bright strawberry, watermelon, and grapefruit. This rose has crisp and refreshing flavors of strawberry and watermelon. This light-bodied, refreshing and juicy blush wine pairs well with a light salad or pasta, seafood, and goat cheeses. Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi wines are great choice for everyday enjoyment, since 1979.
